description: The Marketing Applications Manager will be a scientific leader with a strong customer focus. This person will serve as a technical expert for our customers and collaborators, while supporting the market development of JSR Micro’s life science products. The Marketing Applications Manager will also serve as a technical resource for Product Managers, R&D; Scientists and sales teams to ensure JSR Micro’s success in the life sciences market. This person will lead the US applications team.   The Marketing Applications Manager will be responsible for the following areas:  Developing new application notes to provide customers with powerful and effective solutions with our products. Developing and delivering clear and compelling presentations for current and potential customers. Providing technical support to customers and training customers on new products Providing customer, market and technical insights on a regular basis to drive future product development. Manage the US Applications laboratories and personnel to deliver on time results while maintaining a clean, safe and compliant laboratory environment. Detailed Responsibilities:  Develop the applications roadmap for new products, such as the JSR Life Sciences product line. Provide insight into the latest customer and market needs that drive new products and applications development. Provide expertise in the latest scientific and technical trends in fields directly related to our life sciences product portfolio. Represent the needs of end-user customers on product development and provide input on product development direction. Generate and write standard protocols, technical inserts and application notes for Life Sciences products. Write abstracts, posters and content for scientific meetings and make presentations to enhance the reputation of JSR Micro in the life science market. Solve customer technical support issues and respond to technical information requests from customers. Provides pre-sales and post-sales customer education. Present work at various events such as customer seminars and conferences. Support the R&D; scientists and teams in assay development as needed. Manage a team of application scientists to deliver high performance and timely results. Required qualifications:  PhD degree in biochemistry, or related field or equivalent practical experience. Minimum 3 years management experience. Industry experience in assay development and/or product development. (especially using antibodies for ELISA, sandwich ELISA, bead-based assay etc.) for clinical research or diagnostics applications Publication record in peer-reviewed journals. Demonstrated experience in performing and establishing assays using different assay platforms (e.g. ELISA, sandwich ELISA, qPCR including primer and probe design, Western blot, Flow cytometer, cell culture, construction of expression plasmid, protein and nucleic acid purification, antibody purification, modification and labeling, etc.) Excellent skills in cross-functional work across global sites and multiple departments Ability to proactively and positively work with cross-functional and global teams. Candidates must be fluent in English, with strong verbal and written communication skills. Public speaking is an essential element of the job. Strong presentation skills and the ability to develop clear and compelling power point presentations are required. Excellent technical writing skills for reporting laboratory data and writing technical publications. Excellent customer communication and support skills with US customers – verbal and written. Must be willing to travel to present at conferences and to customer sites – approx. 35% travel. Ability to work independently and be self-motivated. Additional desired qualifications:  3-5 years of post-graduate industry experience. Experience with surface chemistries and microfluidics. Experience working of technical support or customer support. Focus on high quality work in the laboratory and outside the laboratory. Experience working in a GLP compliant environment is a plus. Experience in developing diagnostics assays and gaining regulatory approval in the US is a plus Experience working of clinical evaluation by using clinical samples for diagnostic value is a plus.

description: Start your career with us today and make a big impact on healthcare! Our CSET R&D; Department works closely with other cross-functional groups to ensure successful new product introductions. The internship will be 40 hours a week in the summer months with the potential to go part-time while school is in session. description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies.   Inscopix is searching for a resourceful Talent Acquisition Manager to partner with hiring managers and HR to grow the company. The manager will be responsible for full life-cycle recruiting; source using creative methods (internal and external), recruit, screen, interview and assist with candidate offer.   Responsibilities:  Manage candidates throughout the full recruiting cycle: sourcing, screening, referrals, reference checks, counseling, negotiating and explaining company’s culture Recruit for all functions through the organization, with priorities in the commercial, technical and scientific areas Work with hiring managers and HR as needed to clarify and update job specifications to fill current hiring needs Meet with hiring managers to discuss recruitment strategies when opening positions Develop creative, cost-effective recruitment strategies and determine appropriate recruiting sources for advertising and posting positions Continually develop new sources to identify and proactively build a broad pool of talent Document candidate evaluation and interview process and maintain accurate and well-ordered documentation on all candidates Ensure ongoing communications with internal clients (hiring manager, HR) through regular meetings and other feedback and management of candidates in Jobvite Partner with HR and hiring manager to develop new hire compensation package/offers Conduct reference checks Create and utilize best practice methodologies for recruiting in a fast-paced environment Develop, support and maintain college recruiting and career development programs Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 5 years recruitment experience in life sciences/healthcare industries with a proven track record of quality hires in a high volume recruiting environment Understanding of employment law and HR policies and practices Demonstrate highly effective interpersonal skills with ability to handle various interactions Develop rapport, establish relationships to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization Ability to multi-task with excellent organizational skills, high attention to detail and ability to follow-through Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience working in a fast-paced, high growth environment How to apply:   Please forward cover letter and resume   About Inscopix:   Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate causal neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson’s, autism and schizophrenia.

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies.   Today, neuroscientists at the world’s leading institutions are using Inscopix’s nVista product to image large-scale neural circuit activity in behaving rodents. The raw imaging data sets generated are large and complex and require several stages of processing to extract statistically significant and relevant neural circuit parameters.   Inscopix is seeking a passionate Software Engineer to design and develop the core of our second-generation data analysis suite. The system must efficiently support storage and access to very large video, image and ancillary data sets. It will provide a C++ API for use by the Inscopix software team, and a Python API for our customers. description: The Intelligent Robotics Group conducts an aggressive program of robotics research and development. Research topics include on-board rover autonomy and resource management, planetary surface rover development, real-time computer vision based control of mobile robots and manipulators, human-robot interaction, and 3D terrain reconstruction and visualization. This research and development supports a wide variety of NASA enterprise customers through direct technology delivery, as well as through a program of field-testing of technologies in remote science analog environments and on the International Space Station.  The NASA Ames Intelligent Robotics Group  (irg.arc.nasa.gov) has an immediate opening for a talented software developer to help create advanced 3D teleoperation and visualization interfaces. This is a high-profile, high-impact opportunity to create software that will be used by NASA mission engineers and scientists  The VERVE software platform provides situational awareness and command tools for operating remote robots -from planetary exploration rovers to free-flying robots on the International Space Station to self-driving cars here on Earth. The candidate would apply their knowledge of real time 3D graphics to convey robots' understanding of the world to remote operators.   Position Requirements   • Strong background in interactive, real-time 3D graphics,  including OpenGL and 3D scene-graph architectures  • Solid understanding of networking middleware such as  DDS, ROS, ZeroMQ, JMS, CORBA, etc.  • Expert knowledge of C++ and/or Java  • Experience with physical simulation, visual simulation, data  visualization, or related discipline  • Strong object-oriented design and implementation skills  • Prior experience architecting large scale, distributed, and  multi-threaded software systems  • Prior experience creating intuitive user interfaces for  complex problem solving applications  • Familiarity with common design patterns  • Familiarity with cross-platform development and opensource  tools  Other Desired Skills  • Experience with robotics and/or computer vision  • Experience with mapping and 3D terrain software (GIS,  OpenStreetMap, terrain reconstruction)  • Interest in interaction design  • Experience with 3D modeling software (Blender, Maya) and  other content creation tools (Photoshop, GIMP, etc.)

description: Job Description: Job Summary This paragraph summarizes the general nature, level and purpose of the job. Performs a wide range of medical laboratory tests used to diagnose, treat and prevent disease. Usingtechnical knowledge and a theoretical understanding of the basis of the tests, records and validates the accuracy and quality of results to ensure conformity to specifications. Understands and applies the correct control measures and protocols in cases of abnormal results, reporting any discrepancies to a Senior, Reference, or Supervising Clinical Laboratory Scientist. Calibrates assays where the calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance and records its performance. Performs simple troubleshooting and reports instrument malfunctions to senior staff. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory. Essential Functions The essential functions listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. Employees must abide by all Joint Commission Requirements including but not limited to sensitivity to cultural diversity, patient care, patients rights and ethical treatment, safety and security of physical environments, emergency management, teamwork, respect for others, participation in ongoing education and training, communication and adherence to safety and quality programs, sustaining compliance with National Patient Safety Goals, and licensure and health screenings. Must perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with the Service Standards of the Hospital(s). Accurately performs and completes laboratory analysis on body fluids in accordance with laboratory protocols and policies. Adheres to all safety/health and state/federal regulatory requirements and the procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Demonstrates technical proficiency in all areas of assigned responsibility. Keeps abreast of new technical developments and acquires the necessary skills to adapt to technological changes. Maintains a current understanding of all procedures used in the assigned laboratory section(s) and can interpret the significance of normal and abnormal results. Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisors. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test results to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.  Qualificiations: Minimum Qualifications Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying. Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university Experience: One (1) year of progressively responsible and directly related work experience License/Certification: Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS) Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification. Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to technological changes in the laboratory Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities Ability to solve problems and identify solutions Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization Knowledge and technical proficiency in specialty areas assigned within the laboratory Knowledge of infection prevention policies and procedures Knowledge of local, state and federal regulatory requirements related to areas of functional responsibility Physical Requirements and Working Conditions The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions in which the job is typically performed are available from the Occupational Health Department. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

description: Invent and develop breakthrough molecular biology technologies that impact human health through Genomics. Utilize expertise in molecular assay development, next-generation sequencing, or other enzymatic reactions to create novel nucleic acid measurement technologies. Participate in multidisciplinary projects with chemists, physicists, and engineers to invent disruptive technologies in Genomics across the research to clinical continuum.   Agilent Laboratories, Agilent Technologies’ central research laboratories in Santa Clara, CA is seeking a Scientist to join an interdisciplinary team to invent disruptive technologies in Genomics. The purpose of Agilent Research Laboratories is to power the growth of Agilent Technologies through breakthrough science and technology. The fundamental strengths of Agilent Labs include deep technical expertise, a strong base of technical disciplines, a core competence in transferring technologies to Agilent businesses, and employees who enjoy the richness of a broad, world-class science and engineering environment.   As part of this effort, the Scientist will:  • Build upon a strong working knowledge of molecular biology to innovate and investigate novel molecular measurements that impact Genomics.  • Collaborate closely with cell biology, engineering, and computational research staff to design, plan and perform experiments, collect data, and conduct data analysis.  • Provide technical input to multiple projects that require knowledge of and experience with molecular biology and genetics.  • Establish and participate in collaborative efforts with external thought-leaders in both academic and private sectors, when they can simultaneously accelerate Agilent’s goals and provide value to external collaborators.  • Communicate progress and results to the research and development team, to external collaborators, to management, and, when appropriate, to the general scientific community via presentations at scientific conferences and peer reviewed publications.   Qualifications:  Qualifications  Required:  1. Ph.D. plus up to 5 years of academic postdoctoral training in Genetics, Molecular Biology, Cell Biology, Genetics.  2. Hands-on experience developing novel assays for next-generation sequencing.  3. Demonstrated success in making and communicating leading edge contributions to advancing the field of genetics, genomics, or molecular biology.  4. Demonstrated success in contributing to and leading interdisciplinary teams.  5. Strong problem solving and quantitative data analysis expertise applied to molecular assay development.  6. Track record of excellent interdisciplinary communication and teamwork skills.   Desired:  1. Experience with mammalian cell culture.  2. Experience with immunoaffinity reagents.   Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.   Company:  Agilent

description: Create immersive experiences for millions of people.  Virtual Reality (VR) is rapidly evolving as an important new area in personal computing. The Google VR team is a fast moving group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great VR, developing VR apps and prototyping novel, delightful user experiences. The project started as a 20% project with Google Cardboard. It has since evolved into a vibrant team of full-time VR enthusiasts at Google.  Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including computer graphics, computer vision, information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.  With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Responsibilities  Build the libraries and frameworks that support fast, responsive and beautiful immersive experiences.  Design and implement new user-facing features and applications.  Build VR features for existing applications and prototype new ones. Support diverse clients, including small footprint mobile devices.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.  1 year of relevant work experience.  Programming experience in C/C++ or Java.  Experience in development of interactive applications (mobile, gaming and/or desktop).  Preferred Qualifications  Considerable programming experience in either C/C++ or Java.  Experience in mobile application development (either Android or iOS).  Deep technical knowledge of application development and/or software system development.  Knowledge of 3D graphics and advanced mathematics (linear algebra, calculus) and/or knowledge of UI frameworks and high performance graphics.  Strong foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design optimized for embedded systems.  Specialist domains: Embedded/device systems, mobile operating systems, high performance graphics, client application development for Windows/Mac (Chrome, WebKit, etc.), third party libraries for either Android or iOS.  Area  Making the world's information universally accessible and useful doesn't stop at the desktop. The Mobile team builds tools to get you the information you need no matter where you are. Android has become the world's most popular mobile ecosystem, powering billions of devices, from smartphones to tablets, watches to TVs and everything in between. Whether adding to the core Android experience, forging new markets for digital content, creating immersive and portable versions of our products or managing relationships with a global community of developers, the Mobile team is giving you Google on the go.
jobtitle: Software Engineer, Systems and Applications (Cardboard and Virtual Reality)

description: Additional Location(s) or Information: Job Category: Engineer - Software Level of Experience: Experienced - Non Manager  Requisition #: R1009034 Description: Technical Leader – Cloud Infrastructure The Business Entity The Core Software Group (CSG) has the charter for all Platform Independent and Platform Dependent software development across Switching (for data center, campus core and campus access), wireless, network services, routing, optical software and Enterprise routing and cable access. CSG is creating unprecedented customer value by providing cohesive and innovative software, platforms and solutions for Cisco's core networking customers.  The Team At Cisco, we build products that enable enterprises react faster to the intelligence derived from data. To do that requires a data centric platform that can receive events from a variety of network appliances, and other event sources, process and provides insights. Cisco’s data platform operates at massive scale processing billions of network events across the enterprise and converting that into actionable insights in real time. description: Job Description: Job Summary  The Director of Lab Operations provides overall direction and leadership for assigned clinical areas; ensures effective technical and administrative management of clinical functions and personnel in order to meet the business, financial, customer, service quality and regulatory requirements of the laboratory. This position will be specifically directing the operations of our speciality laboratory (Microbiology, Virology, Cytogenetics, Molecular Pathology, Special Hematology, Flow Cytometry, and Special Chemistry), Anatomic Pathology, a clinical genomics service, and one or more medical office building laboratories.  Essential Functions The essential functions listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. Employees must abide by all Joint Commission Requirements including but not limited to sensitivity to cultural diversity, patient care, patients rights and ethical treatment, safety and security of physical environments, emergency management, teamwork, respect for others, participation in ongoing education and training, communication and adherence to safety and quality programs, sustaining compliance with National Patient Safety Goals, and licensure and health screenings. Must perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with the Service Standards of the Hospital(s).  Adheres to all human resource practices, policies and labor union agreements. Ensures equitably employment treatment of all employees across the organization. Develops and fosters effective communications with client groups and others in order to collaborate on operational needs, business initiatives, program implementations, problem solving, etc. Develops capital and operating budgets that are consistent with the labs overall business plan. Establishes the financial controls and manages the expenditures to meet or exceed budget targets. Accounts for justifiable variances. Develops the policies, procedures and operational requirements for areas of responsibility and ensures compliance with all state, federal and local regulatory agency requirements and Service Standards of the Hospital. Directs and manages the business administration and delivery of one or more clinical areas to ensure that operational, financial, customer, quality and efficiency goals for the labs are met. Engages in business development activities by exploring new revenue streams and by identifying and evaluating new business opportunities. Ensures that business development responsibilities are carried out in accordance with the Hospital policies, operating procedures, performance standards and ethical values. Performs other duties as requested. Provides periodic operating reports to executive groups, councils, committees on projects, programs, performance metrics, funding and utilization of services, etc. Provides strategic leadership in the development and implementation of new programs that increase the Hospital's competitiveness, reputation, service and quality levels, operating efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and customer satisfaction.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification.   Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Ability to develop financial budgets and manage expenses Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities Ability to provide leadership and influence others Ability to solve problems and identify solutions Ability to work effectively as a team player Ability to write system specifications Knowledge and use of databases, data extraction, summary tools Knowledge of laboratory controls, methods, procedures and regulations Knowledge of networking technologies Knowledge of project management process and systems  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.  Qualificiations: Minimum Qualifications: Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.  Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university  Experience: Seven (7) years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience managing CLIA Laboratories  License/Certification: Must be a licensed Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS). Limitedlicense cannot be accepted.

description: Mechanical Engineering Intern  Lumentum (NASDAQ: LITE) is a market-leading manufacturer of innovative optical and photonic products enabling optical networking and commercial laser customers worldwide. Lumentum’s optical components and subsystems are part of virtually every type of telecom, enterprise, and data center network. Lumentum’s commercial lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D sensing capabilities. Lumentum is headquartered in Milpitas, California with R&D;, manufacturing, and sales offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.lumentum.com.  Lumentum is an Equal Opportunity Employer, EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability  We seek an energetic Mechanical Engineering Intern to work in a fast paced laser product development environment. The Mechanical Engineering Intern works directly with engineers and scientists to design parts, design small subassemblies, create component & assembly drawings, spec sheets and all of the necessary documentation for the release of products to volume production. The Mechanical Engineering Intern will work across all functions of the business to create fixtures, parts and small tools to facilitate the product development process and is a vital player developing and productizing Lumentum’s laser technologies to meet large OEM customer specifications for laser based commercial products.  Responsibilities  Component and assembly design documentation (2D drawings from 3D model CAD files, etc).  Basic component, tool and package design, analysis, debug and rework.  Writing documentation for designing, building, testing and reworking assemblies.  Development of lab validation systems for component and module bring-up and test.  Assembly of Lumentum laser based systems and use of lab equipment to troubleshoot and validate system, subsystem and component functionality.  Documentation release and management into an Agile based documentation control system.  ECO & CP creation and management.  Prototype quotation, order, delivery & inventory management.  Certificates of Compliance (CoC) acquisition & management.  Incoming component inspection, prototype assembly, debug and rework.  Basic assembly and test procedure documentation (writing).  Assembly of Lumentum laser based systems and use of lab equipment to troubleshoot and validate system, subsystem and component functionality.  Success Indicators  Basic analytical skills, judgment and problem solving ability.  Team player with the interpersonal skill and personality inclination to work with other team members.  Ability to work independently and take initiative in difficult situations.  Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.  Excellent communication (oral & written), creative problem solving.  High level of integrity, work ethic, responsiveness and commitment to continuous improvement.  Requirements  A total of three relevant work experiences.  Basic Mechanical Design skills and understanding of mechanical design practices.  Demonstrable CAD expertise  Excellent understanding of ANSI drafting standards.  Must be able to properly use standard and precision hand tools.  Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.  At least Senior standing toward a BS in Mechanical Engineering is preferred.  Manufacturing experience/exposure.  Experience with Agile.  Microsoft Project. description: SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is one of 17 Department of Energy (DOE) National Laboratories. Operated by Stanford University on behalf of the DOE, SLAC develops and operates some of the world’s premier science facilities, including the first hard X-ray free-electron laser. Researchers from SLAC and other premier institutions around the world use our facilities to investigate some of the most exciting and important problems facing our society in areas such as clean energy, environmental science, biomedicine, and advanced materials.  The Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) at SLAC National Accelerator Lab is the world’s first hard X-ray free electron laser. LCLS produces pulses of X-rays more than a billion times brighter than the most powerful existing synchrotron sources. Scientists use these highly focused, intense beams of X-rays to reveal the identity and arrangement of atoms in a wide range of materials. The tiny wavelength of X-rays enables study of the arrangement of atoms in metals, semiconductors, ceramics, polymers, catalysts, plastics, and biological molecules. The ultrashort duration of these X-ray pulses can capture images of atoms and molecules in motion. LCLS is operated as an international user facility, attracting hundreds of scientists from around the world to conduct first-of-a-kind experiments to study fundamental processes of chemistry, technology, and life itself.  LCLS has a well-established, centrally managed summer internship program for undergraduate students. Each intern is partnered with a mentor, typically a staff scientist or engineer, who directs the internship project during the summer. The primary goal of the program is to provide interns with a stimulating, real-world research and engineering experience. Technical projects are matched to the interests and skills of each intern, as well as to the programmatic needs of the facility.  Example projects include, but are not limited to the following:  Improvement of control systems, development of new user interfaces  Implement new graphical features for Python-based program  Writing templates for most of common existing IOCs, like Keithley devices, Lakeshore,  Oscilloscopes, Power supplies, MPOD  Portable diagnostic device development  Develop small portable diagnostic devices or electronics boxes to test control hardware like EVR, EDT, Digi, and motor  Work on expanding puppet-inventory script (requires Python)  Work on RHEL7 diskless  Update netconfig inventory, install new monitoring nodes and update documents  Beckhoff PLC control  Build up Visio Symbol library for LCLS-II  Note : This is an hourly, non-benefits eligible temporary-nonexempt, summer internship position (work at 50% full-time equivalent or more), not to exceed 980 hours in six consecutive months. Eligible applicants must be at least 18 years of age and currently enrolled in an educational program or recently graduated and have US work authorization  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS  Education & Experience: Required: Must be enrolled in a degree program in engineering, physics, chemistry, biology, or related field  Excellent problem-solving and analysis skills  Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment  Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to multi-task and complete assignments  Ability to work in a fast-paced and collaborative work environment.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Demonstrated skill with Microsoft Office Suite such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint  Desired: Experience with Python, C/C++  Experience with EPICS, EDM  Experience with Linux OS, databases  Knowledge on serial communication  Knowledge on electronics, PCB Board layout .  SLAC Competencies : Effective Decisions : Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner.  Self-Development : Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing. 40 pounds.   - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.  WORKING CONDITIONS: May be exposed to high voltage electricity, radiation or electromagnetic fields, lasers, noise > 80dB TWA, Allergens/Biohazards/Chemicals /Asbestos. description: Enterprises are aspiring to become data-driven -- insights need to be extracted from data assets, and applied towards business differentiation. We are bootstrapping a team to create the next-generation storage platform enabling customers to apply a multitude of analytics on their data in a turnkey fashion. You will be an early member of a capable and collaborative engineering team that aspires to change the current industry trajectory w.r.t. one-size-fits-one solutions. Together, we will design, develop, and deliver innovative project ideas in a fast paced and technically driven environment. We are looking for engineers who have a strong self-directed work ethic and a make it happen mindset.  Responsibilities:  Lead & contribute to architecture, design, and implementation of a distributed storage platform that runs a variety of popular analytics models for streaming, batch, and interactive analytics. Review and test existing technologies and software components and make recommendations for use and integration. Build rapid prototypes and work on fast paced projects Provide technical specifications, talks, presentations and white papers for new designs and architectures. Collaborate effectively with other staff to solve complex problems. Assist with debugging and verification of defects in your own and others' work. Provide mentorship and lead strong development practices inside the team. Good understanding of popular models for data analytics Good understanding of core building blocks like clustering, replication, serialization, availability, is a huge plus Exposure to multiple programming languages is essential, as the ability to pick up and use the language that suits a body of work is expected. Outstanding coding skills in one or more of those programming languages. Must be capable of researching alternatives and making architectural/design/business decisions independently. History of significant contributions to shipped products. Contribution to OSS is huge plus.  Why work with our Group: VMware’s world-class, award-winning R&D; team is comprised of thousands of top-notch computer scientists and software engineers that are transforming computing through virtualization. Members of the R&D; team voice their creative ideas and watch them become initiatives, participate in exciting short-term and long-term products on the VMware roadmap, initiate advanced research projects, and/or write and test code that ships. At VMware, our engineers continue to learn and grow by working with top professionals from around the world and recent graduates of top universities and by taking advantage of our extensive internal training opportunities and generous external education assistance program. R&D; team members work on the latest computing equipment and have access to the ACM and IEEE libraries. VMware has R&D; offices in: Silicon Valley; Burlington, MA; Cambridge, MA; Broomfield, CO; Sofia, Bulgaria; Aarhus, Denmark; London, UK; Herzliya, Israel; Bangalore, India; and Beijing, China. 73090BR 73090

description: Edison is a world leader in the discovery and development of redox drugs. The company has obtained orphan designation in both the United States and Europe for its first drug candidate, EPI-743 (Vincerinone®). Vincerinone® is now in phase 2 clinical development. It is being evaluated in multiple clinical indications where defects in the mitochondrial proteins and redox control have been well characterized.  Edison Pharmaceuticals’ research efforts are focused on the science of cellular energy and the development of drugs targeting the control of metabolism. Our first clinical indications are a group of diseases collectively known as “mitochondrial disease.” These diseases are frequently inherited and primarily affect children. They commonly result in severe neurological impairment and death. At present, there are no FDA- or EMA-approved treatments. Mitochondrial diseases share a common feature: defects in DNA that encode for proteins critical to the proper handling of electrons. The process of regulating the flow of electrons is known as redox control, and it is essential to the generation and regulation of energy. Thus, mitochondrial diseases are diseases of redox control.   We are seeking an industry-experienced neurobiologist to join a team of scientists responsible for developing first-in-class therapeutic candidates targeting biological energy regulation for the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases. Requirements • Maintain a wide range of primary and immortalized neuronal / CNS tissue culture systems.  • Design and execute target-based assays to identify hits / lead candidates and validate compound mechanism of action.  • Design and execute in vitro and in vivo studies to demonstrate compound pharmacodynamics and support development of early drug candidates.  • Analyze data and communicate findings effectively to multidisciplinary team members and management.   Essential Experience  • BS/MS in Neurobiology, Cell Biology, Molecular Biology, or a related field strongly preferred.  • 10+ years of neuroscience-focused drug discovery experience in the biotech/pharma industry.  • Highly experienced in pre-clinical in vitro high throughput assay development.  • Experience with CNS dissection and primary cell culture techniques / cell line culture techniques.  • Proven track record of contributing to successful and innovative drug development project.  • Experience moving target-based screens to translational in vivo pharmacology / efficacy studies.  • Productive independent worker with excellent time management, communication, and team skills.   Please email your cover letter and resume to careers@edisonpharma.com and reference Job #15009.

The principal goal of TESS is to detect small planets with bright host stars near our own solarsystem, so that detailed characteristics of the planets and their atmospheres can be performed. The TESS data processing pipeline will include heritage from NASA’s Kepler Mission data processing pipeline. Incumbent will define, develop, test and deliver TESS pipeline code.Join a team working on this exciting mission!Education:  Bachelor’s Degree.Master’s degree in Computer Science preferredDiscipline : description: Science Exchange is a small, fast-growing company. Our mission is to enable breakthrough research by providing access to the world’s best labs. We connect researchers both through an online marketplace and a hands-on concierge service. Our talented and dedicated team includes developers, designers, marketers, and, most importantly, scientists, that are charged with bringing intellectual rigor and creativity to every decision we make. We have high expectations of each other and put our customers above all else.  We are looking for a self-driven, detail-oriented designer who is eager to help us achieve our mission. We have so many ideas waiting to be designed and built. If you love working with small, iterative, cross-functional teams to design great user experiences, come join us! You will be involved in every step of the process for both our marketplace and concierge tools. You will work with scientists to understand their unique challenges, research solutions, create flows and mockups, and design UI and graphics.  Responsibilities   Own big design projects, including timeline and status communication Collaborate with team members company-wide to come up with and iterate on concepts Conduct usability testing and gather user data Iterate quickly with Product and Engineering to ship high-quality features Prototype designs and create final, polished UI  Requirements ------------   BS/BA in Art, HCI, Design, or CS, or commensurate professional experience A solid design background with an obsessive eye for visual and interaction details Experience designing responsive web apps in a fast-paced, iterative environment Analytical mind-set with the ability to take on complex design challenges Excellent communication skills and the ability to give and take feedback Self-motivated and able to efficiently run projects without close supervision Desire to stay on top of the latest trends, best practices, and design tools  Ideally -------   2+ years of design and interactive work experience Experience with usability testing and web analytics tools such as Mixpanel, Optimizely, and Google Analytics Front-end development experience working with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript Illustration and/or icon design skills  No recruiters or agencies please. ---------------------------------

Ability to optimize conditions for quantitation and chromatographic separation of analytes from other detectable components in biological samples.Experience in conducting drug transporter studies using different cell lines and in vitro systems is highly desirable.Ability to effectively communicate study designs and results to development teamsAbility to effectively write technical reports for DMPK studies.Job Type: Full-timeRequired experience:Relevant industrial experience in drug metabolism: 1 yearRequired education:Master's

description: General Description  The R&D-Science; team at ProteinSimple is fast-paced and innovative, with a focus on developing unique, pioneering tools for advancements in protein science. The Senior Scientist – Systems will help develop new technologies for protein analysis. This position will report in to the R&D-Science; group and will be significantly involved in product development (Consumables and Instruments), from conceptualization to commercialization.  Key responsibilities  • Drive product development through experimental design and perform in-depth data analysis  • Systematically test and improve analytical instrumentation  • Observe and meticulously record all details during product development  • Develop and optimize reagents along with assay method development and validation  • Collaborate with the Engineering team for system integration  • Write SOPs and QC methods for transferring to Manufacturing team  • Support Marketing to promote ProteinSimple technologies before and after product release by developing application materials for new products

description: Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.  The Tech Staffing Infrastructure (TSI) team is a cross-functional Tech Staffing group within Google People Services (GPS) with industry Staffing knowledge and implementation experience. We’re responsible for overseeing Tech Staffing business operations, Diversity & Inclusion programs, and strategic projects and initiatives across global tech staffing to drive the rhythm of the business. In addition to core responsibilities, the TSI Program Manager partners closely with Tech Staffing and Global People Services functional teams to help optimize solutions and processes across all Staffing functions, to provide execution and operational excellence, enhanced global communication and collaboration, and eliminate duplication. You will leverage your excellent program management experience - including process optimization, a deep understanding of how to leverage innovative technology, and a familiarity with general business analytics - to lead cross-functional change initiatives or problem solve for focus areas.  The role requires broad experience in Staffing processes and operations. You will have core program management responsibilities, taking on strategic design and scale for staffing processes in partnership with cross-functional Google People Services (GPS) teams. The TSI Program Manager must excel in a collaborative environment and effectively handle stakeholder demands and unanticipated roadblocks to achieve program goals while utilizing a hands-on project delivery style. Responsibilities  Provide strategic support to staffing teams and key stakeholders with thought leadership, operational consulting, change management expertise, program design principles and implementation support.  Use analytical rigor to inform decisions, provide insights, and to help us tell a compelling story to our clients and other key stakeholders.  Partner closely with the GPS Effectiveness team to provide a tech staffing implementation point of view for process designs, programs, and policies impacting staffing.  Develop domain expertise across the various GPS roles and systems and build collaborative relationships with other key stakeholders to identify areas and opportunities for further investment in individual and team development efforts.  Oversee as well as contribute first-hand to the creation and on-going evolution of learning initiatives across a wide range of formats (i.e., classroom training, self-study materials, panel, forum discussions, job-exchanges, videos), to support Google’s Diversity & Inclusion team and other strategic initiatives/programs.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.  3 years of Project/Program Management and Operations experience.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with needs assessments, vendor offerings and service assessments.  Subject matter expert across Global staffing functions with a big picture understanding of Google staffing systems.  Self-directed, detail-oriented problem solver with a strong track record of solving complex problems, designing creative strategies and delivering significant impact.  Ability to liaise with Google resources to design global staffing solutions and serve as a subject matter expert for other teams as they design and optimize for efficiency across staffing tools and processes to support Google’s dynamic growth.  Excellent communication and influencing skills across a wide range of audiences with a proven ability to take initiative and drive efforts and projects through productive relationships and a broad knowledge base.  Area  Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

description: Additional Location(s) or Information: Job Category: Engineer - Software Level of Experience: Experienced - Non Manager  Requisition #: R1003835 Description: Senior Software Engineer - UI  The Business Entity The Core Software Group (CSG) has the charter for all Platform Independent and Platform Dependent software development across Switching (for data center, campus core and campus access), wireless, network services, routing, optical software and Enterprise routing and cable access. CSG is creating unprecedented customer value by providing cohesive and innovative software, platforms and solutions for Cisco's core networking customers.  The Team At Cisco, we build products that enable enterprises react faster to the intelligence derived from data. To do that requires a data centric platform that can receive events from a variety of network appliances, and other event sources, process and provides insights. Cisco’s data platform operates at massive scale processing billions of network events across the enterprise and converting that into actionable insights in real time. Cisco’s data platform team consists of Data Scientists, Data Modelers/Analysts, and Platform engineers collaborating on building the next generation data platform that powers the enterprise. Are you pushing the envelope? Here, you'll be designing, implementing, and empowering the world’s best data platform. You’ll lead and collaborate as part of a disruptive software engineering team that is passionate about transforming the networking industry. In this role, You will work closely with the UX Design team to translate their creations into elegant, fast, responsive websites and web applications. The ideal candidate thrives on new challenges, possesses a strong web front end development background, and has the ability to work in a dynamic environment.  You will:  Bring a strong perspective that drives change and motivates engineers to develop simple solutions to complex problems. Build awesome visual experiences, dashboards and analytical applications Collaborate with Product Management and the UX Design team to define user experience requirements Maintain technical knowledge of web front-end industry standards, best practices and trends and evangelizing these within the company  Desired skills:  Develop backend API (via nodejs/express or equivalent) Single page app development Configurable / dynamic and responsive layouts Visualization libraries (d3 / vega/ lyra / raw density or equivalent) JavaScript frameworks (angular /bootstrap / dojo / jquery or equivalent) Experience interfacing with RESTful services Excellent general programming skills and understanding of OO concepts Experience solving large scale engineering challenges A passion to stay ahead of the curve on front end technology and development trends in the industry A working knowledge of UX principles and user experience Experience working with Unit / Integration Testing tools for UI  Bonus:  Experience with: Big Data technology such as Hadoop, Spark, Storm, Kafka or similar Node.js based development such as Grunt/Gulp, Bower, NPM, Express, Mocha Angular.js React TypeScript  Minimum Qualifications  3-5 years’ experience working on a senior high impact software development team MSEE/CS combined with 5+ years of related experience, or BSEE/CS combined with 7+ yrs related experience. Programming experience in JavaScript, HTML5, CSS Linux system development exposure Experience in all phases of SW development cycle with some exposure to agile development methodologies Excellent problem solving skills.  About Cisco: The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.* Job Type: Experienced Opportunity Category: Big Data

description: Clinical Project Manager  Ardelyx ® is building an integrated biopharmaceutical company with a gastrointestinal and cardio-renal focus. Our mission is to serve patients through the discovery, development and commercialization of minimally-systemic therapeutics that target intestinal receptors and transporters to address unmet medical needs.  We are currently seeking a Clinical Project Manager to join our team. This position can be based in Fremont CA, or Boston MA. This person will lead activities associated with the evaluation, initiation and management of clinical studies to ensure compliance with SOPs, FDA regulations and ICH/GCP guidelines. Leads study management team, including oversight of CRO and Vendors. Coordinates the training of staff involved in clinical trial management.  Position Responsibilities Responsible for the preparation and finalization of project and study-related documents that may include: informed consent forms, clinical trial outlines, monitoring plans, synopses, protocols and amendments, IND Annual Updates and clinical summaries, as required. Participate in the selection of investigators and study sites. Responsible for identifying and responding to site and study related issues and recommending corrective actions and/or escalating to supervisor. Coordinate the design, format and content of CRFs, study guides, study reference binders, patient diaries, and forms including participating in the EDC and IVRS specification process and UAT and file/edit study documents in eTMF. Ensure that CRF data queries are resolved. Coordinate and manage Investigational Product including overall accountability and reconciliation Work with Clinical Operations team for the preparation of study budgets and timelines. Manage project timelines and vendor performance to meet departmental and corporate goals. Monitor and track clinical trial progress and provide status update reports. Manage all clinical trial vendors (e.g., IVRS, central labs, IRB, and central ECG). Represent Clinical Operations at the Project Team level for individual studies, as appropriate. Partner with other research and development groups to achieve deliverables. Participate in Site Initiation Visits (SIVs) as required. Co-Monitoring of regional sites for adherence to protocol and GCP as required. Travel as required to carry out responsibilities. Identify and escalate site, vendor and study related issues to supervisor, as appropriate. Participate in clinical and department settings, including attending additional meetings as required, and interact in a positive and professional manner. Supervise Clinical Trial Assistants and Clinical Research Associates, and perform performance appraisals and perform other duties as assigned. Job Requirements BA/BS/MS in a scientific discipline. 7+ years of relevant clinical experience in a CRO, pharmaceutical, or biotechnology company (including at least 3 years of CRA experience and 2 years of study management experience). Must have demonstrated expertise in relevant clinical operations activities. Knowledge of ICH/GCP guidelines and FDA regulations. Ability to exercise independent judgment within generally defined practices and policies that lead to methods or processes for obtaining results. Good organization and planning skills Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills (both written and oral). Ability to problem solve and delegate appropriate tasks to subordinates. Strong leadership skills, self-motivated, adaptable to a dynamic environment. Able to collaborate effectively with the study team, cross-functional team members, and external partners. Proficiency in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Able and willing to travel approximately 10-20%.  As a member of the Ardelyx team, you will help develop therapeutics that are designed to act in the gastrointestinal tract with minimal systemic exposure. Our drug candidates target important diseases and conditions . We are developing novel therapeutic agents that address unmet medical needs, with a gastrointestinal and cardio-renal focus .  We are seeking the best in class scientists, advanced thinkers, and people who thrive on collaboration to co-create the future. You will be working with some of the industry's best scientists in a team environment focused on world-class research. Ardelyx offers a competitive total rewards package, perks and an innovative, dynamic culture and research environment.  Ardelyx, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Help drafting test protocols and reports, conduct test plans and data analysis. Group presentation at the end of the internship Perform other work related duties, as assigned Minimum Qualifications:  Pursuing BS/BA at an accredited college or university. Majoring in Chemistry or a related field, with the concentration or focus in Analytical Chemistry. Minimum one year of completed coursework; Coursework in Liquid Chromatography and Mass Spectrometry Practical knowledge in / Hands-on experience/ Research experience in Analytical Chemistry lab work Proficient with Excel, JMP or equivalent data analysis tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to work in a dynamic environment Preferred Qualifications:  Coursework, skill or project experience in Analytical Chemistry Relocation is not available for this position.   Resume/CV is required. Cover letter is optional.

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies.   Inscopix is searching for a resourceful Talent Acquisition Manager to partner with hiring managers and HR to grow the company. The manager will be responsible for full life-cycle recruiting; source using creative methods (internal and external), recruit, screen, interview and assist with candidate offer.   Responsibilities:  Manage candidates throughout the full recruiting cycle: sourcing, screening, referrals, reference checks, counseling, negotiating and explaining company’s culture Recruit for all functions through the organization, with priorities in the commercial, technical and scientific areas Work with hiring managers and HR as needed to clarify and update job specifications to fill current hiring needs Meet with hiring managers to discuss recruitment strategies when opening positions Develop creative, cost-effective recruitment strategies and determine appropriate recruiting sources for advertising and posting positions Continually develop new sources to identify and proactively build a broad pool of talent Document candidate evaluation and interview process and maintain accurate and well-ordered documentation on all candidates Ensure ongoing communications with internal clients (hiring manager, HR) through regular meetings and other feedback and management of candidates in Jobvite Partner with HR and hiring manager to develop new hire compensation package/offers Conduct reference checks Create and utilize best practice methodologies for recruiting in a fast-paced environment Develop, support and maintain college recruiting and career development programs Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 5 years recruitment experience in life sciences/healthcare industries with a proven track record of quality hires in a high volume recruiting environment Understanding of employment law and HR policies and practices Demonstrate highly effective interpersonal skills with ability to handle various interactions Develop rapport, establish relationships to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization Ability to multi-task with excellent organizational skills, high attention to detail and ability to follow-through Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience working in a fast-paced, high growth environment How to apply:   Please forward cover letter and resume   About Inscopix:   Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate causal neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson’s, autism and schizophrenia.

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies.   Inscopix is seeking a Head of Customer Success to develop and manage our Customer Support/Service Organization comprised of Technical Support, Field Application Engineering and Field Application Science team members. By increasing customer satisfaction and helping to improve our products and services, the Head of Customer Success will boost Customer Lifetime Value, thereby improving customer retention that enables cross-sell and up-sell opportunities and increased product adoption by account.   Responsibilities:  Develop processes that increase customer success with our products and services - Manage, escalate, and drive customer support cases to successful resolution with Sales, Operations, Engineering, and Marketing.   - Advocate on behalf of customers and work with the rest of the company to strengthen customer relationships   - Develop effective and efficient customer feedback processes that drive continuous improvement and influence new product and services development  Improve the effectiveness and efficiency of Customer Success - Develop the necessary support systems, documentation, processes to measure, manage, and improve customer outcomes with our products and services   - Define, track and improve operational metrics for team such as customer satisfaction, response time, resolution time, support cost, etc.   - Develop and implement training programs to address technical and scientific needs of the customer base.   - Develop and manage user forums to foster community collaboration amongst our customer base.  Inspire Customer Success across the Company - Create company-wide culture of Customer Success   - Provide customer feedback and help drive continuous improvement   - Exemplify best practices in industry  Develop a Best-In-Class Team - Attract high potential individual contributors into team   - Create rapid onboarding process for new team members   - Foster collaboration within team and across company   Requirements:  10+ years’ experience in leading life sciences tools/instrumentation organizations Proven track record of building organizations from scratch. Ability to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus building Combined background of post-sale and sales experience Strong empathy for customers AND passion for revenue and growth Deep understanding of value drivers in recurring revenue business models Analytical and process-oriented mindset Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement Enthusiastic and creative leader with the ability to inspire others Excellent communication and presentation skills Bachelor’s degree /MBA preferred How to apply:   Please forward cover letter and resume   About Inscopix:   Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate causal neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson’s, autism and schizophrenia.

description: Every day millions of people seek answers and share their knowledge through Quora. As a User Researcher, you'll work closely with Product Managers, Product Designers, Engineers, and Data Scientists to shape this unique platform. You'll help teams see and understand our users from different vantage points, from micro-interactions to the thousand-foot view of how they're connected. You'll unpack mental models, motivations and cultural norms, with the goal of helping teams improve the product.   Responsibilities:  Plan and execute research for the most impact across the product development cycle. Collaborate cross-functionally. Use research to help product teams make confident decisions, and build empathy and intuition for our users. Communicate findings to working teams and share broadly throughout the company Investigate and experiment with new tools and methods. Innovate how we do research. Support and consult on designer- or pm-led research. Collaborate with Data teams to present both qualitative with quantitative sides of the picture. Requirements:  3+ years of experience in User Research or related field. Degree in: HCI, psychology, anthropology, sociology, or other related domain Strong understanding of different research methods and when to use them: from formative to summative, quantitative to qualitative, or generative to evaluative Experience with concept and language testing, usability studies, paper prototype testing, interviewing, and surveys, at a minimum. Field studies, ethnography, participatory design, diary studies, or A/B testing experience are a plus. Strong communication and organizational skills Experience with recruiting and/or developing screeners Working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design Understanding of and excitement for Quora as a product Expertise in one or more of the following areas: mobile, social media, user-generated content, online communities We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
snippet: As a User Researcher, you'll work closely with Product Managers, Product Designers, Engineers, and Data Scientists to shape this unique platform....

description: A generously funded (more than $13 mln in seed and series A funding) and ambitious early-stage startup with a team of accomplished technical experts in search, machine learning and AI fields, is looking for Inference Scientist to join their team and work on distributed Inference platform that continuously learns ("infers") ever-improving statistical models from web-scale data. The platform follows fundamental probabilistic principles and rigorously evaluates and benchmarks itself on real-world tasks.   Why you should join: Opportunity to work on a small team of ~10 amazing engineers and data scientists. Spend 100% of your time working on a problem with virtually unlimited potential impact. Generous salary, equity, and benefits well above industry norms, including unlimited PTO. Flexible hours and family-friendly culture that values sustained productivity and happiness. Amazing office in historic downtown Palo Alto.  Responsibilities: Establish and expand the rigorous statistical foundations of the inference platform. Develop prototypes and execute experiments to help guide engineering efforts. Explore new model families and inference algorithms.  Requirements: PhD in Computer Science (AI/ML specialization), Statistics, Mathematics (Probability), or equivalent. Strong foundations in probability, linear algebra, and optimization. Background in statistical modeling and inference. Strong drive and desire to work for an early stage startup company and make is a success.  Pluses: Experience with large-scale industrial applications of statistical modeling and inference. Experience with statistical modeling across a diverse range of data sets and domains. Knowledge of Go, C/C++, Mathematica  To apply: Please send your resume in WORD or PDF format to lilia@eltisolutions.com Place the text "Inference Scientist" in the subject line. Provide the date you are available to start work.
snippet: Opportunity to work on a small team of ~10 amazing engineers and data scientists. Place the text "Inference Scientist" in the subject line....

description: Additional Location(s) or Information: Job Category: Engineer - Software Level of Experience: Experienced - Non Manager  Requisition #: R1003837 Description: Senior Software Engineer – Cloud Infrastructure The Business Entity The Core Software Group (CSG) has the charter for all Platform Independent and Platform Dependent software development across Switching (for data center, campus core and campus access), wireless, network services, routing, optical software and Enterprise routing and cable access. CSG is creating unprecedented customer value by providing cohesive and innovative software, platforms and solutions for Cisco's core networking customers.  The Team At Cisco, we build products that enable enterprises react faster to the intelligence derived from data. To do that requires a data centric platform that can receive events from a variety of network appliances, and other event sources, process and provides insights. Cisco’s data platform operates at massive scale processing billions of network events across the enterprise and converting that into actionable insights in real time. Cisco’s data platform team consists of Data Scientists, Data Modelers/Analysts, and Platform engineers collaborating on building the next generation data platform that powers the enterprise. Are you pushing the envelope? Here, you'll be designing, implementing, and empowering the world’s best data platform. You’ll lead and collaborate as part of a disruptive software engineering team that is passionate about transforming the networking industry  You will:  Bring a strong perspective that drives change and motivates engineers to develop simple solutions to complex problems. create reusable components and services in the machine learning space, so we can can quickly and efficiently implement new algorithms, compute pipelines, and persistence stores You’ll scale out the platform to process thousands of events per minute, and be the expert in our team for running our internal systems for stream processing systems and other batch compute engines like Spark and Elastic MapReduce  Desired Skills  Expertise in building high performance, highly scalable solutions deployed on the cloud Expertise in Java, Phyton, GoLang Expertise in container technologies and writing containerized software (docker, lxc, kubernetes, mesos) Experience initiating cross-function collaboration with Ops, Product and Design to develop high quality, focused products (and inspire your team to independently initiate this same collaboration). Experience building high performance distributed system solving large scale engineering challenges Deep understand messaging/queuing systems  Bonus:  Experience with Hadoop, Scalding, Spark, Storm, Kafka or similar Experience with machine learning Experience with AWS and OpenStack technologies  Minimum Qualifications   MSEE/CS combined with 5+ years of related experience, or BSEE/CS combined with 7+ yrs related experience. Programming experience in C/C++/Java/Python, GoLang is a big bonus Linux system development exposure, familiarity with Virtualization Experience in all phases of SW development cycle with some exposure to agile development methodologies Excellent problem solving skills.  About Cisco: The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.*  LI-MS2 Job Type: Experienced Opportunity Category: Cloud
