description: About NICE America Research: Shenhua Group is a major wholly state-owned enterprise (“SOE”) in China and ranks top 200 among the Fortune Global 500 companies in 2015. National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy (NICE) was founded in December 2009 in Beijing, China, and is the corporate research arm of Shenhua Group as well as a national base for technology innovation and business entrepreneurship, especially for highly qualified talents with overseas experience. NICE America Research, Inc. is a newly formed division of NICE and located in the south bay area of Silicon Valley in US. We are building teams to develop cutting-edge sustainable and affordable technologies to improve energy efficiency, protect the environment, and mitigate climate change. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, skill, imagination, passion, and teamwork of people like you. Currently we have multiple openings for senior to entry-level scientist. Candidates at all levels are welcome to apply. We offer competitive compensation packages and excellent benefits. Relocation will be considered.  Job Responsibilities: We are searching for highly motivated, forward-thinking technology enthusiasts to join the Hydrogen Energy team where you will be responsible for designing and performing testing and analysis of PEM fuel cell stacks, modules and integrated fuel cell vehicle systems. 1. Lead hydrogen infrastructure and fuel cell research. 2. Design and execute test plans on fuel cell single cells and stacks. Specify instrumentation and equipment for test stand development and prepare standard operation procedures. 3. Collect, summarize, analyze, and interpret test data and results. Prepare reports for internal review and make recommendations based on results. 4. Perform fuel cell vehicle development, testing, and analysis. 5. Perform hydrogen infrastructure systems testing, codes and standards, and analysis at the component and system level for hydrogen stations. 6. Perform project management activities for a range of projects, including tracking budgets and milestones. Perform work independently and in cooperation with other team members. 7. Follow all ES&H; policies and procedures to ensure and maintain a safe working environment.  Qualifications: 1. Advanced degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or a relevant field with 10+ years industry experience in hydrogen infrastructure and PEM fuel cells. Ph.D. is preferred. 2. Experience with hydrogen infrastructure that includes but is not limited to hydrogen production, compression, storage, and dispensing hardware design and operation. Hand-on experience in fuel cell component development, single cell component performance evaluation, and cell stack/module testing. Experience with fuel cell vehicle development, on-road testing, data acquisition and analysis. 3. Previous experience working with DOE or other government agencies, automotive companies, utilities, and fuel suppliers is highly desired. 4. An innovative and independent thinker. Demonstrated ability to quickly and creatively solve complex technical problems. 5. Excellent oral and written communication skills to work effectively and openly with others, both internally and externally. Good presentation skills. 6. Energetic and self-motivated. Willing to work with flexible schedule in a fast-paced, start-up environment.
jobtitle: Senior Scientist in Fuel Cell Technology

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies.   Today, neuroscientists at the world’s leading institutions are using Inscopix’s nVista product to image large-scale neural circuit activity in behaving rodents. The raw imaging data sets generated are large and complex and require several stages of processing to extract statistically significant and relevant neural circuit parameters.   Inscopix is seeking a passionate Software Engineer to design and develop the core of our second-generation data analysis suite. The system must efficiently support storage and access to very large video, image and ancillary data sets. It will provide a C++ API for use by the Inscopix software team, and a Python API for our customers.   Responsibilities:  Design and implement a high performance run-time and persistent data repository for large scientific data sets Write well designed, testable, efficient code in C++ and Python Validate performance on Windows and Linux platforms Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent Minimum 5 years of experience developing commercial software applications High level of proficiency developing software in C++ and Python for Windows and Linux environments Proficiency using revision control software, preferably Git Proficiency using build management tools, preferably CMake or GNU Make Experience optimizing for high data throughput and efficient on-disk data storage Strong team player in an interdisciplinary environment, comprised of electrical, mechanical, optical engineers and neuroscientists Desirable:  Experience developing Python wrappers for C++ Experience with HDF5 and Qt Experience with distributed computing and GPU acceleration Programming in MATLAB How to Apply:   Please forward cover letter and resume   About Inscopix:   Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate causal neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson’s, autism and schizophrenia.

description: Job Description: Performs a wide range of medical laboratory tests used to diagnose, treat and prevent disease. Using technical knowledge and a theoretical understanding of the basis of the tests, records and validates the accuracy and quality of results to ensure conformity to specifications. Understands and applies the correct control measures and protocols in cases of abnormal results, reporting any discrepancies to a Senior, Reference, or Supervising Clinical Laboratory Scientist. Calibrates assays where the calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance and records is performance. Performs simple troubleshooting and reports instrument malfunctions to senior staff. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory.  Accurately performs and completes laboratory analysis on body fluids in accordance with laboratory protocols and policies. Adheres to all safety/health and state/federal regulatory requirements and the procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Demonstrates technical proficiency in all areas of assigned responsibility. Keeps abreast of new technical developments and acquires the necessary skills to adapt to technological changes. Maintains a current understanding of all procedures used in the assigned laboratory section(s) and can interpret the significance of normal and abnormal results. Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisors. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test results to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.  Qualificiations: Minimum Qualifications: Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.  Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university  Experience: One (1) year of progressively responsible and directly related work experience  License/Certification: Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS)  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification. Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to technological changes in the laboratory Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities Ability to solve problems and identify solutions Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization Knowledge and technical proficiency in specialty areas assigned within the laboratory Knowledge of infection prevention policies and procedures Knowledge of local, state and federal regulatory requirements related to areas of functional responsibility
jobtitle: CLS Staff CHEM HEMA & COAG Clinical Lab

description: At MedImmune, Principal CPK scientist functions as the global Clinical Pharmacology/DMPK (CPD) team representative for biotherapeutic projects at various stages of research and development (target validation through life-cycle management) and is responsible for all aspects of pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamics (PKPD) -related support for biotherapeutic products, including design of studies, analysis and reporting of data, and communication of data in regulatory documents and meetings.   Specific responsibilities include:  * Responsible for providing clinical pharmacology expertise into clinical development plans, including the design, conduct and interpretation of relevant clinical pharmacology studies, including PKPD studies, analysis of data using complex PKPD modelling and simulation methodologies, development and delivery of regulatory strategy (e.g IB/IND, end of phase 2, and BLA) etc, and data analysis and reporting of clinical studies.  * Function as the sole point of contact for all CPD activities on projects at all stages of discovery and development and be able to influence team strategy using modelling expertise.  * Be pivotally involved in assessing and managing analyses of PK/PD data, integrating clinical trial simulation strategies and disseminating the clinically relevant risk/benefit implications to the Company's clinical development teams.  * Collaborate with biostatisticians, clinicians and clinical operation managers for the appropriate design of Phase I-IV studies; contribute to the investigators brochure, clinical study protocol and report analysis and reporting of data, and communication of data in regulatory documents and meetings.  * Drive clin pharm regulatory strategy for projects at all stages -- IND to BLA -- and defend strategy at regulatory meetings.  * Help design and conduct translational PK/PD modelling and simulation to support drug design goals, designs of PK/PD and safety assessment studies, and dosing justifications for first-in-human clinical studies  * Collaborate with toxicologists on the design, monitoring, and reporting of nonclinical safety studies; prepare TK subreports; comply with good laboratory practice (GLP) regulations for GLP studies. Perform PK analyses for GLP studies per SOPs, record data and analysis results in GLP-compliant manner, ensure timely and clear communication with GLP SD/PI on GLP studies, contribute to GLP study reports.  * Mentor other junior PK scientists staff on clin pharm science and strategy.   Position:  * Expertise with standard modelling and simulation software (NONMEM, S-Plus/R, etc) is required.  * Knowledge of the use of modelling simulation and its role in discovery and development of therapeutics is required.  * Strong publication and conference presentation track-record required.  * Expertise in other modelling software (e.g. MATLAB, Berkeley-Madonna, etc) is highly desirable  * Knowledge of bioanalytical expertise, especially of biologics is desirable.  * Knowledge of biologics discovery and development - especially knowledge of bioanalytical strategy and GLP is desirable.   Education:  * A doctorate degree in Pharmaceutics/Pharmacy/Engineering/Statistics with demonstrated expertise in PKPD and clinical pharmacology and strong quantitative skills.  * 8+ years of experience after PhD required.  * Proven track record of extensive experience in population modeling and simulations using NONMEM. Familiarity with statistical software package Splus, R or SAS.  * Good communication and scientific writing skills, and ability to independently work in a matrix environment   ~BSP  *LI-MEDI   Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation

description: Do you enjoy building innovative and compelling products and services? Can you make smart trade-offs? Are you nimble and agile? Do you combine instincts with factual data? Do you enjoy interacting with partners?  If your answer to most questions above is a resounding "YES", then let's talk. We might have the perfect career opportunity for you.   Organization and Team:   The world of Intelligent Agents is pushing the wildest imaginative and innovative products and capabilities. Be a part of the world of Intelligent Agents’ excitement!   Bing Speech Services team, within the Applications Services Group (ASG), is the team that builds the cloud-based speech services that makes science fiction a reality powering the capabilities of Intelligent Agents. The service is capable of understanding what people say, speaks the same language as they do, gives them the answers they want and completes the tasks they need. This service is designed for scalability, availability, and manageability across a wide range of scenarios and platforms such as Cortana, Windows 10, Windows Phone, XBox, HoloLens, Band, Bing Translator, etc. This service is also exposed to customers outside of Microsoft to enable 3rd party developers as Project Oxford to take advantage of the same rich capabilities. The Speech Services team also closely collaborates with researchers and scientists across the company to productize their ideas and bring it to the real world. And we are just getting started. A lot of work is ahead of us as we are looking to build the next generation architecture and flurry of features for speech and natural language processing.   You:   Bing Speech Services team is looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Senior Program Manager to help deliver on a cloud based speech platform for our partners and customers to build delightful applications and user experience. Candidates will have a passion for the latest and greatest technologies and have solid experience standing up and running services in the cloud. A successful PM is the voice of partners in the engineering team and ensure the delivery of the best platform possible.   This role provides a great opportunity to participate in product definition, provide great focus on the devices experience and to coordinate closely with Microsoft's larger NUI and ASG's charter.   Responsibilities:   • Your core responsibilities will include:  • Act as a liaison between business and technical domain  • Ability to co-ordinate and orchestrate product requirements and lead a matrix team  • Creating comprehensive specifications for Speech Services across all components that make up the platform  • Collaborating with distributed teams to gather requirements and drive work  • Owning key technical design issues to build and release the platform  • Working closely with a feature crew throughout the engineering lifecycle  • Driving internal and external partner relationships that are critical to success  • Designing great end-to-end platform experiences   Requirements:   You are great candidate if you can check off the following boxes:  • Enthusiastic, positive, and team oriented attitude  • Bias for action and ability to decompose a complex project/feature with strong data-driven decision making capabilities and experience  • 5+ years of software product/program management experience with proven track record of multiple product cycle delivery  • Proven track record of establishing and maintaining strong cross-team working relationships and collaboration  • Demonstrated excellence in communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills  • Exceptional organization skills, with ability to follow through on all action items and meet expectations  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent   Preferred:   • Experience designing, developing, shipping, or evangelizing cloud platforms  • Familiarity with system architecture, programmability and API design  • Experience in research or development in the fields of Natural User Interface, computer vision, computer graphics, audio or speech processing, or machine learning is a plus  • Leadership experience a huge plus   Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. description: Mechanical Engineering Intern  Lumentum (NASDAQ: LITE) is a market-leading manufacturer of innovative optical and photonic products enabling optical networking and commercial laser customers worldwide. Lumentum’s optical components and subsystems are part of virtually every type of telecom, enterprise, and data center network. Lumentum’s commercial lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D sensing capabilities. Lumentum is headquartered in Milpitas, California with R&D;, manufacturing, and sales offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.lumentum.com.  Lumentum is an Equal Opportunity Employer, EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability  We seek an energetic Mechanical Engineering Intern to work in a fast paced laser product development environment. The Mechanical Engineering Intern works directly with engineers and scientists to design parts, design small subassemblies, create component & assembly drawings, spec sheets and all of the necessary documentation for the release of products to volume production. The Mechanical Engineering Intern will work across all functions of the business to create fixtures, parts and small tools to facilitate the product development process and is a vital player developing and productizing Lumentum’s laser technologies to meet large OEM customer specifications for laser based commercial products.  Responsibilities  Component and assembly design documentation (2D drawings from 3D model CAD files, etc).  Basic component, tool and package design, analysis, debug and rework.  Writing documentation for designing, building, testing and reworking assemblies.  Development of lab validation systems for component and module bring-up and test.  Assembly of Lumentum laser based systems and use of lab equipment to troubleshoot and validate system, subsystem and component functionality.  Documentation release and management into an Agile based documentation control system.  ECO & CP creation and management.  Prototype quotation, order, delivery & inventory management.  Certificates of Compliance (CoC) acquisition & management.  Incoming component inspection, prototype assembly, debug and rework.  Basic assembly and test procedure documentation (writing).  Assembly of Lumentum laser based systems and use of lab equipment to troubleshoot and validate system, subsystem and component functionality.  Success Indicators  Basic analytical skills, judgment and problem solving ability.  Team player with the interpersonal skill and personality inclination to work with other team members.  Ability to work independently and take initiative in difficult situations.  Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.  Excellent communication (oral & written), creative problem solving.  High level of integrity, work ethic, responsiveness and commitment to continuous improvement.  Requirements  A total of three relevant work experiences.  Basic Mechanical Design skills and understanding of mechanical design practices.  Demonstrable CAD expertise  Excellent understanding of ANSI drafting standards.  Must be able to properly use standard and precision hand tools.  Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.  At least Senior standing toward a BS in Mechanical Engineering is preferred.  Manufacturing experience/exposure.  Experience with Agile.  Microsoft Project. description: Associate Scientist - Protein Purification & Characterization-BIO004520   Description   Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.   Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career. Hands on experience with AKTA FPLCs, Waters and Agilent HPLC instruments is a plus   - Experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry is a plus   Qualifications   Education:   - Bachelor’s Degree   Required:   - Minimum of 1 year work experience in protein purification and analytical characterization.   - Solid and proven theoretical basis and hands on experience in protein purification and characterization   - Strong data analysis sills   - Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly present findings in front of groups   - Strong organizational skills   Preferred:   - High-throughput analytical characterization of proteins and antibodies. description: Edison is a world leader in the discovery and development of redox drugs. The company has obtained orphan designation in both the United States and Europe for its first drug candidate, EPI-743 (Vincerinone®). Vincerinone® is now in phase 2 clinical development. It is being evaluated in multiple clinical indications where defects in the mitochondrial proteins and redox control have been well characterized.  Edison Pharmaceuticals’ research efforts are focused on the science of cellular energy and the development of drugs targeting the control of metabolism. Our first clinical indications are a group of diseases collectively known as “mitochondrial disease.” These diseases are frequently inherited and primarily affect children. They commonly result in severe neurological impairment and death. At present, there are no FDA- or EMA-approved treatments. Mitochondrial diseases share a common feature: defects in DNA that encode for proteins critical to the proper handling of electrons. The process of regulating the flow of electrons is known as redox control, and it is essential to the generation and regulation of energy. Thus, mitochondrial diseases are diseases of redox control.   We are seeking an industry-experienced neurobiologist to join a team of scientists responsible for developing first-in-class therapeutic candidates targeting biological energy regulation for the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases. Requirements • Maintain a wide range of primary and immortalized neuronal / CNS tissue culture systems.  • Design and execute target-based assays to identify hits / lead candidates and validate compound mechanism of action.  • Design and execute in vitro and in vivo studies to demonstrate compound pharmacodynamics and support development of early drug candidates.  • Analyze data and communicate findings effectively to multidisciplinary team members and management.   Essential Experience  • BS/MS in Neurobiology, Cell Biology, Molecular Biology, or a related field strongly preferred.  • 10+ years of neuroscience-focused drug discovery experience in the biotech/pharma industry.  • Highly experienced in pre-clinical in vitro high throughput assay development.  • Experience with CNS dissection and primary cell culture techniques / cell line culture techniques.  • Proven track record of contributing to successful and innovative drug development project.  • Experience moving target-based screens to translational in vivo pharmacology / efficacy studies.  • Productive independent worker with excellent time management, communication, and team skills.   Please email your cover letter and resume to careers@edisonpharma.com and reference Job #15009.

description: About NICE America Research: Shenhua Group is a major wholly state-owned enterprise (“SOE”) in China and ranks top 200 among the Fortune Global 500 companies in 2015. National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy (NICE) was founded in December 2009 in Beijing, China, and is the corporate research arm of Shenhua Group as well as a national base for technology innovation and business entrepreneurship, especially for highly qualified talents with overseas experience. NICE America Research, Inc. is a newly formed division of NICE and located in the south bay area of Silicon Valley in US. We are building teams to develop cutting-edge sustainable and affordable technologies to improve energy efficiency, protect the environment, and mitigate climate change. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, skill, imagination, passion, and teamwork of people like you. Currently we have multiple openings for chief to senior to entry-level scientist. Candidates at all levels are welcome to apply. We offer competitive compensation packages and excellent benefits. Relocation will be considered.  Job Responsibilities: The Energy Internet Focus Area aims to develop technologies for renewable energy generation (e.g., solar), energy storage (batteries), distributed energy system (Solid Oxide Fuel Cells, SOFCs), and nano grid demonstration (architecture, software, power electronics, device integration, energy management, etc.). The successful candidate at the Chief Scientist level is expected to: 1. Build and lead a technically strong, multidisciplinary team. 2. Lead the effort in building a state-of-the-art electronics lab with key functions of control software development, chip application, and hardware integration. 3. Analyze global technology and market trend in clean energy industry. Identify emerging new technologies. Develop the technology roadmap for the Energy Internet Focus Area. Propose projects that could deliver and make impact in next few years. 4. Supervise project managers for the daily operation of the Energy Internet team. Manage R&D; projects targeting agreed on timeline, milestones, and budget. 5. Build pilot scale units and supervise operation. 6. Work closely with our Beijing site expert panel to keep the goal aligned and results delivered in time. 7. Build strong relationship with customers. Identify collaboration opportunities with leading university research groups and government agencies. 8. Mentor staff and promote their individual growth and development.  Qualifications: 1. Advanced degree in Engineering, Physics, Math, etc. For Chief Scientist level, 15+ years industrial R&D; experience is required. For lower level positions, less experience is required. 2. The candidate should have at least one of the technical background in: energy control & management, battery SOC or generation/load forecasting, smart sensing IC architecture design and application, real time simulation or hardware-in-the-loop, complex system analytical background (dissipative structure / Chaotic theory / Fractal Geometry ). 3. The candidate should have direct R&D; experience in Internet+ energy field such as System-on-Chip and System-in-Package based IC design, battery management system, energy storage, renewable energy, big data for energy, active distribution network, smart grid, power-to-gas design for energy application. Experience in the product-driven R&D; environment with hands-on capability to understand and solve real engineering or scientific problems in the field. 4. Excellent publication or patent records with successful commercialization experience. 5. Have global vision and strategy for the clean energy technologies of 21st century. Passionate for R&D; in new field such as Energy internet, which is the area integrating many disciplines from Internet of things / smart grid to hydrogen storage / power to gas etc. 6. Able to manage or work in a fast-paced & fast-growing innovation team with many skill-sets that could complement or challenge each other from market-driven perspective. 7. Eager to learn new technology / culture / thought process with team-spirit. 8. Strong Project management skills or capability with proactive and self-driven attitude.

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Since the introduction of our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista (selected by The Scientist as the top Life Sciences product of 2013), we have built a customer base of highly prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including multiple Nobel Laureates) and major pharmaceutical companies. As we expand our business and build-out our R&D; team, we are seeking talented, creative, and self-motivated engineers with a penchant for innovating outside the lines and who are passionate about developing the next generation of breakthrough innovations for the neuroscience market.   As an Optical Engineer, you will be a key member of the Engineering team and involved in developing sophisticated, miniaturized opto-mechanical and opto-electronic devices for large-scale observation and modulation of neural circuit activity. You will have the unique opportunity to work and thrive in an interdisciplinary environment of top-notch engineers and neuroscientists.   Responsibilities:  Explore and develop novel optical imaging techniques Design custom optical elements and optical pathways Bring optical systems from concept to prototype Support knowledge transfer to the manufacturing team when moving to production Ideal Candidates Have:  Master’s degree or PhD in Optical Engineering, or related discipline with extensive experience working with optical imaging systems 5+ years of experience Passion for exploring and developing unconventional imaging techniques Experience designing optical systems with optical CAD tools (e.g. Zemax, both sequential and non-sequential modes) Experience with imaging system design Knowledge of fluorescence imaging methods Strong communication skills and the ability to work with minimal supervision Bonus Skills:  Knowledge of designing optical elements for aberration correction Knowledge of diffractive optics Experience with stray light analysis and compensation Knowledge of illumination design and analysis Experience with optical quality test methods How to Apply:  Please forward Cover Letter with Resume   About Us:  Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson's, autism and schizophrenia.

description: As a Staff Product Designer, you'll build products that enable people to share knowledge in ways that have never been possible: Give writers the tools to share their expertise, and create network incentives that encourage creation of high quality content; Help people discover the topics they care about, and create a feed of interesting, personalized content that is delightful to read; Grow our user base through rigorous A/B tests that affect on signup, retention, and virality; Explore how our iOS and Android apps can empower new forms of knowledge sharing made possible by mobile technology.   The vast majority of the world's knowledge is still locked in peoples' heads, inaccessible to the internet. Quora's mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, so people can make smarter decisions, find their dream jobs, raise their families better, and much more. description: SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is one of 17 Department of Energy (DOE) National Laboratories. Operated by Stanford University on behalf of the DOE, SLAC develops and operates some of the world’s premier science facilities, including the first hard X-ray free-electron laser. Researchers from SLAC and other premier institutions around the world use our facilities to investigate some of the most exciting and important problems facing our society in areas such as clean energy, environmental science, biomedicine, and advanced materials.  The Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) at SLAC National Accelerator Lab is the world’s first hard X-ray free electron laser. LCLS produces pulses of X-rays more than a billion times brighter than the most powerful existing synchrotron sources. Scientists use these highly focused, intense beams of X-rays to reveal the identity and arrangement of atoms in a wide range of materials. The tiny wavelength of X-rays enables study of the arrangement of atoms in metals, semiconductors, ceramics, polymers, catalysts, plastics, and biological molecules. The ultrashort duration of these X-ray pulses can capture images of atoms and molecules in motion. LCLS is operated as an international user facility, attracting hundreds of scientists from around the world to conduct first-of-a-kind experiments to study fundamental processes of chemistry, technology, and life itself.  LCLS has a well-established, centrally managed summer internship program for undergraduate students. Each intern is partnered with a mentor, typically a staff scientist or engineer, who directs the internship project during the summer. The primary goal of the program is to provide interns with a stimulating, real-world research and engineering experience. Technical projects are matched to the interests and skills of each intern, as well as to the programmatic needs of the facility.  Example projects include, but are not limited to the following:  Improvement of control systems, development of new user interfaces  Implement new graphical features for Python-based program  Writing templates for most of common existing IOCs, like Keithley devices, Lakeshore,  Oscilloscopes, Power supplies, MPOD  Portable diagnostic device development  Develop small portable diagnostic devices or electronics boxes to test control hardware like EVR, EDT, Digi, and motor  Work on expanding puppet-inventory script (requires Python)  Work on RHEL7 diskless  Update netconfig inventory, install new monitoring nodes and update documents  Beckhoff PLC control  Build up Visio Symbol library for LCLS-II  Note : This is an hourly, non-benefits eligible temporary-nonexempt, summer internship position (work at 50% full-time equivalent or more), not to exceed 980 hours in six consecutive months. Eligible applicants must be at least 18 years of age and currently enrolled in an educational program or recently graduated and have US work authorization  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS  Education & Experience: Required: Must be enrolled in a degree program in engineering, physics, chemistry, biology, or related field  Excellent problem-solving and analysis skills  Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment  Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to multi-task and complete assignments  Ability to work in a fast-paced and collaborative work environment.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Demonstrated skill with Microsoft Office Suite such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint  Desired: Experience with Python, C/C++  Experience with EPICS, EDM  Experience with Linux OS, databases  Knowledge on serial communication  Knowledge on electronics, PCB Board layout .  SLAC Competencies : Effective Decisions : Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner.  Self-Development : Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing. 40 pounds.   - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.  WORKING CONDITIONS: May be exposed to high voltage electricity, radiation or electromagnetic fields, lasers, noise > 80dB TWA, Allergens/Biohazards/Chemicals /Asbestos.  WORK STANDARDS: Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations. Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned. Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu .  Qualifications:
jobtitle: Summer Student – Controls and Data Systems

description: Posted Feb 29 – Accepting applications  About H2O.ai   H2O is the premier open-source machine learning platform that is transforming how big data applications are built. With H2O, data scientists can take both simple and sophisticated models to production from the same interactive platform they for modeling, at entreprise scales. Our customers have built powerful domain specific predictive engines for recommendations, pricing, outlier detection in fraud and insurance. The H2O.ai team is a mixture of Software, Math, Data Science and Product people working with the open source community to build H2O   Our team is looking for a UI Engineer to make data exploration quick and beautiful for data scientists and business analysts. You will work directly with product designers and machine learning engineers to build the components in the next generation of data driven products.   H2O has made data science easy to do. Next we will make the results easy to see, and fun to investigate. You will help build visualization and tools that make machine learning accessible to every business in the world.   Responsibility Work with designers to define UI and interactions around data-driven products Collect and synthesize product requirements with product teams, and translate them into engineering requirements Prototype workflows and visualizations for data exploration and machine learning Work with data scientists and engineers to develop data-driven applications Develop and maintain reusable UI components across multiple projects Qualifications Love for cross-disciplinary work in design, data science, and engineering Strong proficiency in web-based UI engineering (Javascript, CSS, HTML) Strong portfolio of work demonstrating an instinct for beautiful, comprehensible user interfaces Experience with React.js and D3.js Experience with client-side application architecture Experience with interactive data visualization on the web Ability to empathize with non-technical stakeholders – from whom you will gather insight and requirements Ability to prioritize in a iterative prototyping-oriented process Pragmatism (i.e. focus on delivering value, not tool purity) Bonus Points You don’t need to be proficient in every aspect – what we are looking for is a strong core set of skills, the ability to improvise and a collaborative spirit. Position is located in Mountain View, CA. Working remote is not available at this time.

description: About E Ink:   E Ink offers candidates unique opportunities to shape the future. E Ink technology has enabled the creation of a new $10+ billion ebook market in less than 10 years. Our technology is being adopted in many new applications that would surprise even a loyal follower. Today you can find E Ink enabled products in applications such as electronic shelf labels in stores, smartphones, wearable devices and digital signage, to name a few. E Ink’s unique technology is currently being adopted in such novel applications as luggage tags for travel, smartcards for financial institutions, architectural design and even smart packaging for pharmaceuticals. In many instances E Ink is enabling products that would not be possible otherwise. Our customers are leading innovators themselves, often developing new products for completely new applications. Customers include Amazon, Sony, Rimowa, Displaydata, Abbott Diabetes Care, Global Display Systems and the Palladio Group.   E Ink has a rich history. Starting as a spinoff from the MIT Media Lab, it has become the leading innovator and manufacturer of electronic paper displays (EPD) and technologies in the world. It has business and R&D; offices in Massachusetts, California and Hsinchu, Taiwan. E Ink team members around the world take pride not only in what has been accomplished but in the potential of what is possible in the future. This is a unique opportunity to join a team of the brightest minds in the business and shape that future.   About the Position:   The Electrical Engineer will join our research center to design next generation epaper products for specific applications in a cross-function setting. The role offers incredible opportunities to collaborate within and across R&D; teams utilizing knowledge and innovations in display front panel, electro-optical material design, driving scheme, display algorithm, color science, solid state physics, backplane design, image processing and physical/electrical modeling. You will work with multi-disciplined scientists/engineers internationally to plan various types of experiments for optimizing overall display performances on module devices through analysis of the display’s electro-optical behaviors on TFT based your understanding of the physical and electrical properties of solid state devices. You will also take the lead to explore the special requirements of display optical performances, invent and develop driving schemes, algorithms, image processing to further boost the overall display performances of new electrophoretic display product based on core understanding and modeling of the electrostatic and electro-optical properties of the epaper front plane. The job function requires close collaboration across different technical disciplines, and creativity when working independently.   Responsibilities  • Will work with FPL (front panel laminate) product development stake holders to establish key display characterization method to understand the electrical-optical properties of new product designs, and implement quantitative performance index to reflect product specification  • Design new display algorithms and innovative driving schemes for novel applications  • Design and execute electro-optical experiments  • Investigate root causes, including data mining and full systems analysis  • Perform statistical analysis and build mathematical models to understand electro-optical phenomena  • Investigate root causes, including data mining and full systems analysis   Qualifications  • M.S. degree in Electrical, Physics, Computer, mechanical engineering, Applied Math or related field plus two to five years of post-graduate research experience or Ph.D. degree in Physics, Electrical, Computer, mechanical engineering, Applied Math or related field.  • Programming experience required: proficiency with Labview and/or Matlab  • Experience in solid-state physics is a plus  • Excellent root cause analysis skills  • Experience with electronic devices and laboratory equipment such as oscilloscopes, power supplies and function generators  • High energy and a self-driven attitude, initiative, hand-on, and a passion to understand how things work and how to make them better  • Excellent troubleshooting, team work and communication skills  • Ability to work in a fast paced dynamic environment  Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here . The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

description: Schafer Vallecitos Laboratories, Inc. (SVL) is seeking a talented Senior Scientist / Engineer to add to its Sunol, California laboratory staff. The successful candidate will be expected to perform and lead a group of other scientists, engineers and technicians in complex sample processing and optical microscopy analyses on customer samples. Daily team interaction with scientists, engineers and technicians, as well as participation in the maintenance of auxiliary equipment is required. SVL performs materials characterization and related analytical services on commercial and government contracts. Devise or modify analysis techniques and procedures to address new analytical requirements. Constructively interact with scientists, engineers, and technicians. Participate in equipment maintenance. Establish themselves as a key resource for Schafer and our customers, helping maintain our expertise in the field of sample processing and optical microscopy. Desired Qualifications:  Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to write clear scientific and technical reports. Demonstrated ability to solve complex technical problems. Expertise in scientific data analysis and quality control. Ability to work under broad managerial direction. Team oriented with the ability to manage small groups of people. Must be a U.S. citizen with the ability to obtain a government security clearance. Schafer Corporation is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer, offering a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a professional working environment.   Schafer’s facility is a tobacco-free work place.   “Vallecitos” (California)

description: A generously funded (more than $13 mln in seed and series A funding) and ambitious early-stage startup with a team of accomplished technical experts in search, machine learning and AI fields, is looking for Inference Engineer to join their team and work on distributed Inference platform that continuously learns ("infers") ever-improving statistical models from web-scale data. Strong drive and desire to work for an early stage startup company and make is a success. Strong foundations in probability, statistical analysis, linear algebra, and optimization. Some experience with C/C++ is highly desirable  Pluses: MS or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent. Experience with large-scale industrial applications of statistical modeling and inference. Experience with machine learning platforms. Understanding of recommendation engines and predictive ranking technologies.  To apply: Please send your resume in WORD or PDF format to lilia@eltisolutions.com Place the text "Inference Engineer" in the subject line. Provide the date you are available to start work.

description: About NICE America Research: Shenhua Group is a major wholly state-owned enterprise (“SOE”) in China and ranks top 200 among the Fortune Global 500 companies in 2015. National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy (NICE) was founded in December 2009 in Beijing, China, and is the corporate research arm of Shenhua Group as well as a national base for technology innovation and business entrepreneurship, especially for highly qualified talents with overseas experience. NICE America Research, Inc. is a newly formed division of NICE and located in the south bay area of Silicon Valley in US. We are building teams to develop cutting-edge sustainable and affordable technologies to improve energy efficiency, protect the environment, and mitigate climate change. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, skill, imagination, passion, and teamwork of people like you. Currently we have multiple openings for senior to entry-level scientist. Candidates at all levels are welcome to apply. We offer competitive compensation packages and excellent benefits. Relocation will be considered.  Job Responsibilities: We are searching for highly motivated, forward-thinking technology enthusiasts to join the Hydrogen Energy team where you will be responsible for designing and performing testing and analysis of PEM fuel cell stacks, modules and integrated fuel cell vehicle systems. 1. Lead hydrogen infrastructure and fuel cell research. 2. Design and execute test plans on fuel cell single cells and stacks. Specify instrumentation and equipment for test stand development and prepare standard operation procedures. 3. Collect, summarize, analyze, and interpret test data and results. Prepare reports for internal review and make recommendations based on results. 4. Perform fuel cell vehicle development, testing, and analysis. 5. Perform hydrogen infrastructure systems testing, codes and standards, and analysis at the component and system level for hydrogen stations. 6. Perform project management activities for a range of projects, including tracking budgets and milestones. Perform work independently and in cooperation with other team members. 7. Follow all ES&H; policies and procedures to ensure and maintain a safe working environment.  Qualifications: 1. Advanced degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or a relevant field with 10+ years industry experience in hydrogen infrastructure and PEM fuel cells. Ph.D. is preferred. 2. Experience with hydrogen infrastructure that includes but is not limited to hydrogen production, compression, storage, and dispensing hardware design and operation. Hand-on experience in fuel cell component development, single cell component performance evaluation, and cell stack/module testing. Experience with fuel cell vehicle development, on-road testing, data acquisition and analysis. 3. Previous experience working with DOE or other government agencies, automotive companies, utilities, and fuel suppliers is highly desired. 4. An innovative and independent thinker. Demonstrated ability to quickly and creatively solve complex technical problems. 5. description: Principal Scientist, Biologics Discovery: BIO004534   Description   Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.   Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.   The Biologics Discovery, DMPK and Disposition function at MRL, Palo Alto focuses strongly on the application of computational biology, systems pharmacology and quantitative principles during the discovery and early development for biologics in an integrated fashion   The position will be a critical and senior member of the function providing strong expertise necessary for development of:   - The central core modeling and quantitative expertise for the Department. The modeling efforts will be in support of projects related to:   - Drug and combination therapeutic concepts and dose predictions for the design and conduct of preclinical efficacy and nonclinical safety studies  - Computational biology and systems pharmacology principles in order to establish and build predictive preclinical drug combination frameworks with application in various therapeutic areas  - Mechanistic approaches (and in an integrated fashion) for integration of key properties such as-- target expression, gene profiles, signaling and pathways, construct properties, disease considerations-- for establishing exposure-response relationships in relevant preclinical studies and assisting in projection of doses in early human clinical studies in support of IND submissions.  - Network analysis and application of bioinformatics principles in data mining and evaluation/interpretation of complex biological systems  - Independently managing functional deliverables, collaborating with the senior PK/PD scientists for implementation of advanced quantitative approaches in support of nonclinical development of various projects (from discovery to FIH studies).  - Collaborates and coordinates extensively and effectively across functions and both internally and externally to achieve program deliverables as part of a team.  - Management experience is required   Qualifications   Education:   - PhD. In Computational Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Mathematical Sciences with focus on Biostatistics, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biochemical Engineering with strong background in quantitative sciences and systems approaches   Required:   - Minimum of 8 years of combined industry and/or postdoctoral experience in relevant field with strong focus on application of quantitative sciences in drug and biologics development  - Strong experience in PK-PD modeling, simulations and application of biostatistics and PK-PD approaches  - Strong communication, managerial experience, writing skills and ability to function in a highly team-oriented environment  - Background and familiarity with the fundamentals of pharmacology, physiology and basic principles of drug actions, and the drug development process   Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives. description: The vast majority of the world's knowledge is still locked in peoples' heads, inaccessible to the internet. Quora's mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, so people can make smarter decisions, find their dream jobs, raise their families better, and much more. We think Quora will have an enormous long-term impact on the world.   As a member of the Product Design team, you'll build products that enable people to share knowledge in ways that have never been possible: Give writers the tools to share their expertise, and create network incentives that encourage creation of high quality content; Help people discover the topics they care about, and create a feed of interesting, personalized content that is delightful to read; Grow our user base through rigorous A/B tests that affect on signup, retention, and virality; Explore how our iOS and Android apps can empower new forms of knowledge sharing made possible by mobile technology.   Product Design Interns work on meaningful projects in user-facing areas of the product. Our previous interns have led a complete redesign of Quora's onboarding experience, and built Reading List ( https://blog.quora.com/Reading-List-%E2%80%94-A-New-Way-to-Save-Content-to-Read-Later ). Each intern is paired with a mentor, who works closely with the intern to give detailed guidance on their projects, and help develop key design skills.   Responsibilities:  Work on a product team focused on a major user-facing area of Quora. Identify high impact features that achieve goals, and be able to explain rationale for your decisions. Collaborate with engineers to define features and functionality, with other designers for feedback and critique, and with data scientists and user researchers to evaluate the impact of your work. Design interactions for new features, applying existing design patterns and creating new ones, across our web and mobile platforms. Build what you design using a custom web framework developed by Quora that makes front-end development easy and efficient. Work quickly and effectively on significant projects. Ship new features, bug fixes, and small improvements multiple times a week. Requirements:  Ability to think at a high level about a complex, social product, and explain the rationale for new features and changes. Experience building clear, effective interactions to accomplish product or business goals. Experience with visual design, especially in the construction of visual hierarchies on layouts, and attention to detail on typography, spacing, and colors. Experience with with common front-end technologies (e.g. HTML, CSS, Javascript). Experience with server-side languages like Python is a plus. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: About NICE America Research: Shenhua Group is a major wholly state-owned enterprise (“SOE”) in China and ranks top 200 among the Fortune Global 500 companies in 2015. National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy (NICE) was founded in December 2009 in Beijing, China, and is the corporate research arm of Shenhua Group as well as a national base for technology innovation and business entrepreneurship, especially for highly qualified talents with overseas experience. NICE America Research, Inc. is a newly formed division of NICE and located in the south bay area of Silicon Valley in US. We are building teams to develop cutting-edge sustainable and affordable technologies to improve energy efficiency, protect the environment, and mitigate climate change. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, skill, imagination, passion, and teamwork of people like you. Currently we have multiple openings for chief to senior to entry-level scientist. Candidates at all levels are welcome to apply. We offer competitive compensation packages and excellent benefits. Relocation will be considered.  Job Responsibilities: The Energy Internet Focus Area aims to develop technologies for renewable energy generation (e.g., solar), energy storage (batteries), distributed energy system (Solid Oxide Fuel Cells, SOFCs), and nano grid demonstration (architecture, software, power electronics, device integration, energy management, etc.). The successful candidate at the Chief Scientist level is expected to: 1. Build and lead a technically strong, multidisciplinary team. 2. Lead the effort in building a state-of-the-art electronics lab with key functions of control software development, chip application, and hardware integration. 3. Analyze global technology and market trend in clean energy industry. Identify emerging new technologies. Develop the technology roadmap for the Energy Internet Focus Area. Propose projects that could deliver and make impact in next few years. 4. Supervise project managers for the daily operation of the Energy Internet team. Manage R&D; projects targeting agreed on timeline, milestones, and budget. 5. Build pilot scale units and supervise operation. 6. Work closely with our Beijing site expert panel to keep the goal aligned and results delivered in time. 7. Build strong relationship with customers. Identify collaboration opportunities with leading university research groups and government agencies. 8. Mentor staff and promote their individual growth and development.  Qualifications: 1. Advanced degree in Engineering, Physics, Math, etc. For Chief Scientist level, 15+ years industrial R&D; experience is required. For lower level positions, less experience is required. 2. The candidate should have at least one of the technical background in: energy control & management, battery SOC or generation/load forecasting, smart sensing IC architecture design and application, real time simulation or hardware-in-the-loop, complex system analytical background (dissipative structure / Chaotic theory / Fractal Geometry ). 3. The candidate should have direct R&D; experience in Internet+ energy field such as System-on-Chip and System-in-Package based IC design, battery management system, energy storage, renewable energy, big data for energy, active distribution network, smart grid, power-to-gas design for energy application. Experience in the product-driven R&D; environment with hands-on capability to understand and solve real engineering or scientific problems in the field. 4. Excellent publication or patent records with successful commercialization experience. 5. Have global vision and strategy for the clean energy technologies of 21st century. Passionate for R&D; in new field such as Energy internet, which is the area integrating many disciplines from Internet of things / smart grid to hydrogen storage / power to gas etc. 6. Able to manage or work in a fast-paced & fast-growing innovation team with many skill-sets that could complement or challenge each other from market-driven perspective. 7. Eager to learn new technology / culture / thought process with team-spirit. 8. Strong Project management skills or capability with proactive and self-driven attitude.

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies. We are seeking an experienced Sales Manager to partner with our Head of Sales to lead our field sales efforts in the US West region including Western and Central Canada. The position will provide the opportunity for an experienced sales professional to take on a leadership role at a company that stands to make a major impact on the field of neuroscience. The Sales Manager will focus on placing the nVista technology, and associated consumables, within Universities and Institutes. Ideal candidates should have a track record of closing sales opportunities for instrumentation/capital equipment in the life science research solutions industry. The ideal candidate will have aptitude for developing relationships and directly interacting with Principal Investigators and Group Leaders by telephone and in person across a variety of Universities and Institutes.  Responsibilities: Prospect, qualify and generate sales by researching and identifying target customer labs Close sales and achieve quarterly sales quotas for nVista system packages in the western United States and western and central Canada Pursue sales prospects by providing on-site sales presentations, technical consultations, and evaluations of scientific fit Work closely with the product and technical teams (field application scientists and in-house Application Science team) to field customer inquiries and provide accurate technical information Manage sales pipeline and track progression of opportunities Update and manage Salesforce CRM database to track Sales activities in the western United States and western and central Canada Report and forecast on sales of nVista systems and consumables in the western United States and western and central Canada Analyze key metrics surrounding progression of sales opportunities to optimize sales cycle and value propositions Represent Inscopix at scientific meetings and conferences in the US Remain knowledgeable and current on changes and developments in the neuroscience community  Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree (an emphasis in Sales, Marketing, and/or Business Administration is preferred) Minimum of 5 years of field sales experience preferably selling to neuroscience labs Track record of over-achieving quota Demonstrated ability to plan, lead and implement projects both independently and with support from others. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to work directly with all levels of the organization as well as with customers. Strong listening and presentation skills Salesforce Guru - familiar with generating reports and creating custom fields Moderate travel (20-40%) for customer visits and conferences  How to Apply: Please forward cover letter and resume  About Inscopix: Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate causal neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson’s, autism and schizophrenia.

description: Position Summary:  Responsible for the management and clinical execution of clinical trials. Functions as the Clinical Trial Manager (CTM) on the planning, implementation and delivery of all operational aspects of assigned clinical trials, from protocol concept through to completion, according to timelines, budget, operational best practices and quality standards (ICH GCP/ Country and Local requirements/ Company SOPs). May also be assigned as Clinical Indication Lead CTM, with line manager and additional project level responsibilities.   Essential Functions:  • Responsible for preparation of clinical trial documents, e.g. protocol (as lead author), informed consent, source documents, CRFs, recruitment materials, instructions to investigators/patients, study newsletters.  • Contribute to (review/approve) other essential documents and clinical trials materials, including monitoring plans, data management plans, statistical analysis plans.  • Responsible for ensuring ordering and management of drug supplies, and other provided clinical trial materials.  • Ensure development, management and maintenance of trial information trackers (e.g., dates of study activities, subject recruitment status/disposition, study contacts, etc.)  • Interact with Investigator sites and CRAs/CROs/vendors to ensure smooth study set-up and excellence of study conduct, reviewing site/vendor performance, compliance with the protocol, and maintaining awareness of issues raised and any corrective actions.  • Partner with Clinical Finance associate in developing clinical study agreements and budget payment schedules according to protocol specifications.  • Review and approve all study payments, and ensure oversight of trial budgets through interactions with Finance.  • Assist in the evaluation of new clinical sites and external service providers. Manage the CRO and vendor selection process for assigned clinical trials.  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with Investigators and Site Coordinators, CRO and vendor contacts.  • Oversee or directly manage the CRO and vendor interactions related to clinical trial conduct.  • Responsible for ensuring site qualification, initiation, site training, monitoring and close out activities are performed  • Responsible for organization and chairing of Investigator meeting(s) (as appropriate), and/or Site Initiation meeting(s). Ensure creation and delivery of quality Investigator/Site Coordinator training.  • Train and support the CRA(s)/CRO(s) on the study protocol requirements, serving as main point of contact for managing/answering questions relating to trial procedures.  • Coordinate activities of associates (internal & external), manage actions, and actively track study progress to ensure completion according to specified timelines, budget and quality standards. Communicate study progress to Clinical Management and others (as appropriate).  • Coordinate data management, and the data analysis and interpretation activities. Manage collection and maintenance of clinical data, and assist in data review and data query resolution to ensure high quality data are available in a timely manner.  • Ensure topline reports and clinical study reports are accurate, data is analyzed appropriately, and reports are completed in a timely manner.  • Ensure set-up and maintenance of Clinical Operations files and the Trial Master File (TMF) for assigned clinical trials, ensuring all relevant study records are filed and archived with good documentation practices in compliance with regulatory requirements and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).  • Maintain a high level of professional expertise through familiarity with clinical literature on assigned clinical indications.  • May be assigned as Clinical Indication Lead CTM for a project indication. Additional responsibilities can include: line manager for CTM(s) dedicated to that project indication (and other Clinical Operations associates, as required), contributing to project level documentation (e.g., IBs, Annual Safety Reports), coordinating activities across studies within a project (e.g., consistency in protocols, study reports), assisting in coordination of clinical contributions to regulatory submissions, and attending and participating in project team meetings.  • Act as a mentor to support the training and on-boarding of new hires. Function as a Subject Matter Expert (as assigned).  • Responsible for maintaining knowledge on ICH-GCP and current company SOPs.  • Requires approximately 5% business travel.   Requirements  Preferred Experience:  • At least 6-8 years related experience in study management with  Global Phase III clinical trials for small biopharma with focus in biopharma  • Track record of managing multiple complex clinical trials  • Understand subjective studies & quality of life clinical trials  • Clinical trials experience in dermatology or neurology  • Knowledge of ICH-GCP, current regulations and standards   Preferred Education:  • BA/BS degree in life sciences or a related subject required  • MS or PhD level scientist with life sciences background   Preferred Additional Skills (i.e., Computer):  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and computer skills  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel  • Ability to work in a team and independently, and to manage multiple priorities with minimal support in a fast pace environment  • Ability to interact with a wide range of people and build strong positive relationships  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

description: at Delphix (View all jobs) Menlo Park, San Francisco, Boston. Senior Platform Systems Software Engineer.  Description: The Delphix team is looking for exceptional computer scientist to join our engineering team to develop distributed platforms and services that scale. Our core java platform is responsible for connecting everything together, supporting our data platforms, front end, and distributed management experience.  Key Responsibilities: Build Distributed Systems that just work from a functionality, performance and scalability standpoint. Research, Design, Implement, Test your feature. Own end-to-end delivery. Work closely with cross-functional teams  Requirements: B.S or M.S in Computer Science 4+ years experience building software in at least two languages in a production environment Strong understanding of systems, databases, and the cloud Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Ability and desire to work in a fast paced, test-driven, agile, collaborative and iterative programming environment Desire to create new things, dive in wherever there's a need, and learn new things  Pluses: Deep understanding of some (any) large, complicated system Knowledge of Data Masking technology. Expertise with internals of data storage systems (databases, file systems) Experience with distributed systems  What we look for: Ability to think clearly and articulate your vision to others of varying technical comprehension A strong foundation in data structures and algorithms, and a strong understanding of threads, synchronization, concurrent programming Expertise in programming and using the right tool for the job A passion for designing and developing elegant intuitive high quality software A BS or MS in Computer Science from a top tier university  Delphix Engineering Culture  We have an amazing engineering-driven culture. Engineers are empowered to fundamentally drive the future of the company. We?ve built a culture where everyone is empowered to voice good ideas and feels a sense of ownership in everything they do. Engineers have the freedom to identify customer problems, articulate solutions, and drive end-to-end execution of projects and strategy. Whether it?s developing new abstractions in the file system, designing an architecture to interoperate with a new applications and databases, or developing a new cloud paradigm for virtualizing data, there is no lack of hard problems and opportunities at Delphix.  Our team is built to mentor and support engineers in their growth as innovators and leaders. We work with engineers, recent graduates and experienced engineers alike, to find their unique path within the company, and avoid institutional impediments to their success. Team projects provide opportunities to learn from smart and thoughtful experts. Our processes and leaders help others find and establish ownership of new projects, technical areas, and key product strategies. Delphix engineers are relentless in their pursuit of new opportunities to learn and grow, and relish the opportunity to share their knowledge and experience with others.  Delphix Engineering is a team of world-class Computer Science problem-solvers with areas of excellence in data structures, algorithms, design patterns, object models, and coding. Our engineers don?t just code: they drive end-to-end product strategy and delivery. The team includes the inventors and architects of the VMware platform, ZFS, DTrace, Oracle RAC, DataGuard, and Flashback. We?re looking for the next great innovators to join us.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
