description: Job Description  At AgilOne, you will be responsible for developing and communicating product messaging, and compelling value propositions through effective messaging to a diverse set of customer targets. The role includes developing deep customer insights and creating effective strategies, messaging and content across different channels, and compelling stories that convey our vision and strategy. The role will collaborate with the Product Management, Demand Generation, Data Scientists, and Sales teams to ensure successful execution. This is a startup--so only resourceful self-starters need apply; in this role you'll move fast, expand your expertise, and make a BIG impact. This is an opportunity to become a recognized thought leader in this hot space.  Responsibilities: Develop consistent product messaging and positioning strategy for our target markets. Analyze buyer personas, market trends, verticals and competition to better position AgilOne Create compelling and easy-to-understand presentations and collateral for Sales Enablement and Market education Collaborate with Product Management, Demand Gen, Web Site and Sales teams to plan and execute product launches/releases Drive messaging and content (videos, decks, interactive tools, white papers, datasheets, and more) for both strategic and tactical initiatives Create inspiring and compelling product demos and customer videos Qualifications  Minimum of 5+ years in product marketing in SaaS environment Proven experience leading the marketing strategy and execution for a specific product Proven ability to balance big picture thinking and attention to detail Experience in martech or ad-tech space Hands-on experience in retail, brand marketing or e-commerce a plus Has an existing portfolio of work to show and share Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Ability to communicate complex concepts simply and clearly Entrepreneurial attitude, takes ownership and delivers results with little guidance Must have enough of a technical background and curiosity to pickup our technology and the business of our customers quickly  Additional Information  What to expect Competitive pay, medical, dental, vision, disability, life benefits 401k plan Stock options Catered lunches, snacks and beverages A fun environment to work hard and play harder Passionate people building great products

description: This position can be filled at either the Scientist I or Scientist II level depending upon experience.   The Applied Immunology and Microbiology group, part of the MedImmune Translational Sciences California team, is seeking a highly motivated individual with expertise in bioanalytical method development.   Major Duties and Responsibilities;   * Initiate, design and hands-on development of analytical methods to execute bioanalytical strategies  * Implement new technology and critically review data to support clinical programs and for internal and external publications;  * Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) of clinical biomarker assays and collaborate with cross-functional team members in a fast-paced environment with strong verbal and written communication skills  * Develop SOPs, data transfer specification forms and data analysis templates (including validation)  * Design and execute assay qualification and validation experiments, performing sample testing for clinical specimen testing, if necessary  * Serve as representative on cross-functional Translational Sciences project team  * Coordinate technology and methods transfer to external collaborators at Contract Research Organizations (CROs) and provide training of analysts at CROs to perform clinical specimen testing  * Monitor assay performance and provide technical support to CROs performing clinical specimen testing  * Manage CROs for method transfer, validation, sample analysis monitoring and report generation  * Coordinate timelines for activities in collaboration with project management   ~BSP
jobtitle: Scientist I/Scientist II, Molecular Diagnostics & Immuno / Cell Based Assays

description: Help protect NASA's information systems on Earth and beyond! If you are an IT Security Specialist with a desire to sharpen your skills in an enterprise environment, then check out our opportunities on our contract supporting Ames Research Center in Mountain View, CA.  ASRC Federal Research and Technology Solutions (ARTS) is seeking an Information Security Analyst with Monitoring and Detection with experience in the field of Information Security to join our growing team in supporting NASA's Security Operations Center (SOC) at Ames Research Center in Mountain View, CA.  Responsibilities  Monitor NASA agency sensors and SOC (Security Operations Center) systems for incidents and malicious activity Analyze security events and identify relevant incidents Correlate and discover relationships between seemingly unrelated events and incidents Generate high quality reports Perform packet analysis and analyze network traffic for security events Coordinate with both Tier 1 and Tier 3 teams while providing incident handling and response support for the agency Contribute to process improvement and efficiency  Requirements (Education, Skills & Abilities)  BS degree in relevant field/technology or equivalent years of experience 2+ years related experience Experience reviewing and analyzing large amounts of raw log data (firewall, network flows, IDS, system logs), Experience with well-known information security related tools such as Wireshark, Kali, Netcat, TCPDump and NMAP Knowledge of common attack methodologies, tactics and protocols Familiarity in a command line environment in all operating systems Possess a strong foundation in networking fundamentals with deeper knowledge of TCP/IP and other core protocols Knowledge of common network based services and common client/server applications Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Track record of being motivated to learn and thrive on challenges Commitment to Excellence; Thirst for Knowledge Ability to work in a 24/7/365 shift environment Ability to obtain a government security clearance (US Citizenship is required)  Desired Skills  Experience working in a mission critical security operations team, preferably 24x7 Experience with enterprise level security incident event management tools such as ArcSight or Splunk Scripting (Python, Perl or Shell) CEH, Security+, GCIA are desired certifications  ASRC Federal Research and Technology Solutions, (ARTS) focus is on technical and complex, mission-oriented services with contracts supporting federal government agencies. Our team of scientists and professional management personnel allows us to bring real-world experience to meet the growing demand for solutions to some of the most complex problems in aviation, IT management, aviation, and Earth and space sciences.  ARTS was awarded a five-year, $400 million contract to provide IT services ranging from cloud computing to network & information security, as well as application management, system administration and technology development.  ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.  ASRCGD  Additional Information:
jobtitle: Information Security Analyst-Monitoring and Detection for NASA - Mountain View, CA

description: Keysight Technologies has been unlocking electronic measurement insights for 75 years. No other company offers our depth and breadth of measurement tools and expertise. Our singular focus helps scientists and engineers address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. With our help, they are better able to deliver the breakthroughs that make a measurable difference in the world.   You will have the opportunity to contribute to the development of radiofrequency test system for Long Term Evolution mobile technology (http://www.keysight.com/en/pd-2208387-pn-T4010S/lte-rf-test-system?cc=ES&lc;=spa) for a company that is a market leader in delivering innovative technologies, solutions and services to wide range of customers in communications and electronics. Here is what you will be measured on:   Understanding of 3GPP specifications for radiofrequency   Use of Long Term Evolution (LTE) user equipment (mobiles or devices under test-DUT)   Analysis of LTE radiofrequency test results, including:  . Signalling between eNodeB emulator and DUT  . Configuration of DUT (AT commands,...)  . Configuration of measurement instrumentation  . Capture of measurement results  . Result data post-processing  . Physical sense of measurements results  . Results comparison between different measurement systems  . Test time analysis  . Repeatability analysis   Development/Verification of radiofrequency test cases either:  . For conformance solutions (normative test cases require to commercialize a mobile terminal)  . For design and development solutions, which help mobile manufacturers to refine their designs or operators to compare performance of different mobile terminals  . For operators specific test plans, which ensures that a mobile terminal will work as expected in a given operator network   Performing of manual radiofrequency measurements using instrumentation as Spectrum Analyzers, Signal generators, switching units, power sensors,...)   Qualifications :  -Completion of junior year at an accredited 4 year university.  -Advanced knowledge in Standards related to LTE (Long Term Evolution) Technology  - High Level of English.  - Experience in Programming measurement Instrumentation (Spectrum Analyzers, Signal Generators, etc.)  - Experience in Object Oriented Programming  - Team work skills

description: Microcode engineers at Ambarella are responsible for the design, development and implementation of advanced imaging and video algorithms across our line of proprietary SoCs. As a member of our team, you will be working with industry-recognized scientists and architects to bring our superior video quality to a variety of camera markets including sports, wearable, IP-security and more.  For this position, we are seeking a talented engineer with a particular interest in the IP-security camera market, a domain with complex video and image quality requirements.  Responsibilities: Develop a deep understanding of Ambarellaâs DSP architecture to ensure the efficient use of hardware resources such as CPU cycles and memory during code development. These resources are critical to scaling imaging algorithms to various scenarios and resolutions (e.g., 4K). Review feature requests with the application and system teams. Design and develop microcode within the boundaries defined by the relevant algorithm and DSP. Understand features from a customer point-of-view and propose well thought-out APIs to cover all possible corner-case scenarios. Debug low-level software in various environments such as a pre-silicon simulation model, during silicon bring-up, as well as during the production phase. Develop and debug software in a test environment to verify the performance of various functional areas of the microcode, such as CFA, filters, video CODECs, and more. Drive development activities in pre- and post-silicon environments.  Requirements: A Bachelorâs degree in EE, computer engineering, CS or equivalent. A masterâs degree in one of these disciplines is preferred. 3+ years of experience developing in C. 1+ year experience with assembly code development and debugging. Solid knowledge of scripting languages such as Perl. 1+ year experience with computer architecture including registers, interrupts, threads, on-chip memory and DRAM. Must be able to resolve data synchronization issues with computer architecture. Must be comfortable with modern software development methodologies such as code review, unit testing, peer reviews, and more. Familiarity with image processing and video compression standards (e.g., MPEG, H.264/265). Must have basic knowledge of video representation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent analytical, problem solving and presentation skills. Excellent cross-functional, cross-site teamwork abilities.  VentureLoop: Connect with Startups. Get in the Loop.
